description: Sarah Kanner (Friling) K.was born on 29 May 1882 in Braila, Romania, into an Orthodox, well-to-do family.As a great lover of Yiddish theatre she had a sister and older brother who would often visit the guest-starring troupe of Aneta Finkel, and there she often used to take and bring home as a guest the actor Leib Kanner

title: Sam Kaplan
description: Sam (Zachariah) Kaplan K.was born in 1885 in Psherosla (Przerośl -- ed.), Suwalki kreyz, Poland.His father was a teacher in a Talmud Torah, which had brought him over with his family to Suwalki

title: Yitzhak Kaplan
description: Yitzhak Kaplan (Isadore) Born in 1874 in Pereyaslav, Ukraine.Father -- a notary.Received a home education

title: Zelda Kaplan
description: Zelda Kaplan Zelda was born on 22 January 1935 in New York, America.She graduated from public school, high school and also studied for two semesters at Brooklyn College.She received her Yiddish studies from the Arbeiter Ring (Workmen's Circle) school, from which she graduated

title: Zunye Kaplan
description: Zunye Kaplan Artist of the Crimea Jewish collective theatre, killed in a battle with the Nazis.Sh.E

title: Anya Kapustin
description: Anya Kapustin According to Jacob Botoshansky, after the outbreak of the first World War, K.participated in her revue theatre in Bucharest.It was noted about her: "A Yiddish girl who came to the theatre as a chorus singer and later became the soubrette of the troupe

title: Nadia Kareni
description: Nadia Kareni(Shlifkovitch) D.was born on 28 October1905 in Lodz, Poland.Her father was a tailor

title: Liba Karlik
description: Liba (Lena) Karlik Above is a photo of an unidentified male, included with her photo, within her Lexicon biography.Born on 15 March 1875 in Lemberg, Galicia.Her father was an usher/ticket taker in the Yiddish theatre

title: G.A. Karlos
description: G.A.Karlos Born on 20 July 1888 in Odessa, Ukraine.Father -- employed by an Odessa fort

title: Misha Karlos
description: Misha Karlos K.was a member of the Vinnitsa-Zhitomir State Yiddish Theatre.He fell at the Front in the struggle against the hated Nazis.

title: Max Karp
description: Max Karp He may have been born circa 1856 in Sandov Vishnia, near Lemberg, Galicia.He immigrated to Romania, where he worked as an employee in a large firm in Galatz (Galati), where he met Goldfaden in February 1877 in a "Lebanon" association meeting, and as Goldfaden depicted him in his autobiography of their very first meeting: "Finally the door opened, and in came an elegantly dressed young man, his physiognomy was fairly easy to recognize, that he is of the noble Jewish ideal.He is a bookkeeper from a large firm

title: Rosa Karp
description: Rosa Karp Born on 10 January 1882 in Focsani, Romania, to the actors Issachar Goldstein and his wife, Sophie, who later married Max Karp, who adopted her as his daughter.As a four-year-old child, she arrived with her mother in America, where she learned in a public school, then completed high school.At the age of eight she performed in a children's role with her mother

title: Sophie Karp
description: Sophie Karp (Sarah Segal, Goldstein) Born approximately 1859 in Galatz, Romania.Her parents were not rich.According to Libresco, her mother ran a restaurant

title: Dora Karpinovitsh
description: Dora (Devorah) Karpinovitsh K.was born in 1919 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.Her father was Moshe Karpinovitsh, the theatre impresario

title: Vadya Kasiakov
description: Vadya Kasiakov He was born in 1908 in Kiev.He was educated in a children's home.At sixteen years of age he began to attend the Yiddish theatre studio in Kiev led by Novak

title: Suzi Kasten
description: Suzi Kasten T.was born in Balta, Southern Russia, now Ukraine.Her father was the Kazianer rabbi

title: Izak Kasvan
description: Izak (Yitzhak) Kasvan K.was born on 13 March 1909 in Remniku, Sarat, Romania.His father was a Hebrew teacher in the Isai school "Steur" for an entire year

title: Ben-Zion Katz
description: Ben-Zion Katz Born in 1897 in Kamenetz-Podolsk, Ukraine.While serving in the Russian army during World War I, K.became a prisoner of the Austro-Hungarians

title: Isaac Katz
description: Isaac Katz On 14 January 1895 the troupe of Kalman Juvelier performed in Bucharest, "Eliahu hanovi, oder, Aristobulus melekh yehuda, a historical operetta in five acts and one prologue, in written rhymes." We bring here (rewritten by Y.Kara) the complete, anonymous review in Bucharest's "Folksblat," changing the orthography, and with short remarks about certain German publications: "On the 14th and 15th of January [this year], this piece was premiered on the Yiddish stage by the 'Juvelier' troupe, and in spite of the fact that we see no great admiration for the Yiddish theatres as the reason we saw this cause, we must repeat the fact that this piece is interesting enough.It can be one of the best-regarded words ever published by Yiddish literature

title: Izidor Katz
description: Izidor [Itzhak-Kalman] Katz K.was born in January 1889 in Shumsk, Volin Gubernia, Russia.His father worked in a mill

title: Michael Katz
description: Michael Katz Born in 1908 in Vilna, Polish-Lita.His father was a manufacturer.He learned in a cheder, then in the Vilna Yiddish governmental gymnasium [high school]

title: Katz
description: Katz Assistant director in the Lwow State Yiddish Theatre.At the age of about thirty, he was killed together with his entire family in the Lwow ghetto.Sh

title: Adolph Katzer
description: Adolph Katzer According to the actor Harry Miller, K.came to America in 1900.He was a [shanton]-singer and was a lyric tenor

title: Jacob Katzman
description: Jacob Katzman Born in 1858 in Odessa, Ukraine.At age three he lost his father, and his mother, laden with three sons, later married.Due to poverty he learned in the local Talmud Torah and a little Russian in the Odessa Kazioner school

title: Hershl Kaufman
description: Hershl (Harry) Kaufman (Feyner) Born in 1880 in Britshan, Bessarabia, to well-to-do parents.Until age six he was completely dumb.Until the age of fourteen he learned in a cheder

title: Jacob Kelter
description: Jacob Kelter M.was born on 12 December 1880 in Warsaw, Poland, into a well-to-do family.He completed the local conservatory

title: Morris Kenig
description: Morris Kenig (Chliwner) K.was born in 1892 in Warsaw, Poland, to Orthodox parents.As a child he sang in Gozik's school, and from there through Dr

title: Joseph Kessler
description: Joseph Kessler K.was born in 1881 in a small town near Budapest, Hungary.At the age of ten he immigrated with his family to America

title: Khaim-Yosef Keymon
description: Khaim-Yosef Keymon Born in 1891 in Lublin, Poland.His parents were bakers.Until age fourteen he learned in a cheder

title: David Keyzerovitsh
description: David Keyzerovitsh K.was born in 1889 in Warsaw, Poland.In 1905 he participated with "amateurs" in the "Akosta" production in the Muranover Theatre

title: Mania Keyzerovitsh
description: Mania Keyzerovitsh (Varshilevska) K.was born in 1885 in Tiraspol, Ukraine.Her father was a businessman

title: Khaklai
description: Khaklai (Feldman) Descended from Russia.Was for a short time in the land of Israel, and because of this his name in Hebrew became "Khaklai." Later he settled in Bessarabia, and during the First World War from there he deserted to Romania.Jacob Botoshansky writes: Brown and terrifyingly nervous, his bulging eyes constantly seemed to bulge larger and larger

title: [?] Khalan-Khalanov
description: [?] Khalan-Khalanov Kh.was an Odesser, an intellect, who became the first actor and producer in Shomer's troupe in Russia.Having gone to the city, Kh

title: A. Khalif
description: A.Khalif Kh.was born in 1900 in Odessa, Ukraine, to well-to-do parents

title: Yosef Khash
description: Yosef Khash Born in Grodno, Polish Lithuania.His grandfather....was a cantor and shemash.He learned in a cheder-msukn

title: Moshe Khashkes
description: Moshe Khashkes Kh.was born in 1830 in Vilna (in Birov?), Polish Lithuania.He learned in various yeshivas, while at the same time also receiving an education and learning further in the Zhitomir rabbinical school

title: Leyzer Khasin
description: Leyzer Khasin Kh.was born in 1915 in White Russia.In 1939 he completed the Moscow Yiddish Theatrical School, and he acted in the Yiddish theatre in Birobidzhan

title: Misha Khasin
description: Misha Khasin Kh.was born circa 1915.He completed the Moscow Yiddish theatrical school

title: Moshe Khatshevatsky
description: Moshe Khatshevatsky Born on 30 January 1897 in Buki, near Uman, Ukraine.His father was a teacher in a Talmud Torah.He learned in a cheder, Talmud Torah, and in 1910 completed the commerce school in Uman, later studying in high school in Petrograd and Yekaterinoslav

title: Lisa Khavina
description: Lisa Khavina (Lahke Khevin-Mida) Kk.was born on 16 March 1894 in Slonim, Grodno Gubernia, Poland.Her parents were enlightened merchants

title: Tevye Khazak
description: Tevye Khazak Kh.was born on 7 November 1887 in Vitebsk, White Russia.His father was a clock maker

title: Khayim Arye Khazan
description: Khayim Arye Khazan Kh.was born on 15 June 1863 in Amdur, Grodno Gubernia, Polish Lithuania.He learned in cheders and in the Grodno Yeshiva

title: Yosef Kigel
description: Yosef Kigel K.was born circa 1921 in Vinitse, Ukraine.In 1937 he performed in the Moscow Yiddish theatrical school

title: Sarah Kindman
description: Sarah Kindman Born on 2 July 1901 in Dzhurkov, Eastern Galicia.Her father was a briner.She finished elementary school and learned German and Yiddish privately

title: Jacob Kirschenbaum
description: Jacob Kirschenbaum K.was born on 28 October 1885 (according to "Who is Who in American Jewry," it was 1884) in Dolina, near Stryi, Galicia.He learned in a cheder, and in a folks shul

title: Hirsh Meir Kirshenbaum
description: Hirsh Meir Kirshenbaum Born in 1889 [according to Reyzen -- 1892] in Lipsk, Radom region, Poland, into a Chasidic family.Received a strong religious education.Learned in a cheder and yeshiva and went on to become a ritual slaughterer

title: Ben-Zion Kit
description: Ben-Zion Kit Noakh Nakhbush recalls: "Prompter, co-founder of the troupe, traveled everywhere with the 'Vilner [Vilna Troupe].' A very nice man, not tall, a geviksiker, strong Yiddish bahavnter, with a love for better Yiddish theatre, had acted very well as the teacher in the one-act, 'Hercules,' in Zalmen Zylbercweig's translation of Leib Kadison's stage direction.In the drama 'Jews' by Chirikov, he played a clockmaker.Incidentally, when I was in Warsaw in 1938-39, Kit was connected with a Yiddish newspaper in Vilna." Joseph Sandel writes about him in the book, "Ungekumene yidishe kinstler in poyln": "Ben-Zion Kit was a journalist and also wrote songs

title: Moshe Michal Kitai
description: Moshe Michal Kitai Born on 13 April 1886 in Riga, Lettland [Latvia].Due to the hardships with the "life rights," his parents were poor, and since the age of seven he was raised in Zager, wherein his mother traveled over to with the children.At the age of fifteen he returned to Riga to his father, early on was a member of a Hebrew association, then in the "Bund," and thereafter in S.'S

title: Max Kletter
description: Max Kletter Born on 1 May 1901 in Rutinia [according to others in Otinir], near Stanislawow, Galicia.His parents were artisans.His friend, the actor Moshe Tarlowski, writes that K.'s father was one of the best cabinet makers in the town, literally an artist in his profession, who hoped that when his son graduated from the Baron Hirsch school, he would follow in his footsteps, and also become a cabinet maker, but K

title: Nathan Klinger
description: Nathan Klinger Born in 1893 in Vigonko, near Chertkow, Galicia, to Chasidic parents.The family moved to Czernowitz, where K.completed a folkshul, a small gymnazie, and a trade school

title: Isaac Klumak
description: Isaac Klumak Born in 1888 in Koidanov, Minsk Gubernia, White Russia.At the age of about fourteen, he arrived in America where he worked in shops, and at the same time went through high school, became a pharmacist.For a short time he worked as a pharmacist, then studied as a sheep (tson) doctor and practiced as same in New York

title: [?] Kneler
description: [?] Kneler B.Gorin writes in his history of the Yiddish theatre: "That (I.Y

title: Paulina Kobrin
description: Paulina Kobrin (Segal) Born in 1875 in Bialystok, Russian Poland.She received a Jewish education, and later she made it through the courses of a five- to six- class gymnasium.She wandered off to America, where in 1893 she married Leon Kobrin, and since then, along with him, translated an entire range of works, which often were published-- as Zalmen Reisen tells it-- due to editorial reasons-- in the name of her husband

title: [Yakov?] Kofler-Lemkov
description: (Yakov?) Kofler-Lemkov His first name may be Yakov.According to Bernard Fishman, he was born in Bucharest, Romania.According to Yekhiel Landau, he was born in England, but his parents brought him with them to Rumania, where he received his education

title: Abe Kogut
description: Abe Kogut Born on 19 December 1878 in Tost, near Tarnopol, Galicia.Father -- a tailor.He learned in a cheder

title: Israel Kompaneyets
description: Israel Kompaneyets K.was born in 1900 in Feodosiya in the Crimea.His parents were the theatre veterans Aba and Leah Kompaneyets

title: Leah Kompaneyets
description: Leah Kompaneyets (Gotlib) K.was born in Kiev, Ukraine Her parents were merchants.Already as a fourteen-year-old girl she entered into the troupe of Abraham Fiszon under the name "Trotskaya," where she quickly became a prima donna

title: Max Kompaneyets
description: Max (Mordechai, Motek) Kompaneyets Born in 1905 in Warsaw, Poland.Parents -- the Yiddish actors Aba and Leah Kompaneyets.Received a good education

title: Motl Kon
description: Motl Kon K.was born in 1905 in Lodz, Poland.He was raised in a business-oriented family, but due to his love for the theatre he gave up a career in business, and with enthusiasm he was allowed into the Ararat Theatre, where Moshe Broderzon used to call him "Der khaluts (The Pioneer)" because of his deep devotion and love for the theatre

title: Khristesko Profira Konstantinova
description: Khristesko Profira Konstantinova (Kristerman) K.was born in 1880 in Bucharest, Rumania, into a Christian family.Her father was a railroad worker

title: Joseph Kopelman
description: Joseph Kopelman K.was born in 1893 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a carpenter

title: Louis Kopelman
description: Louis Kopelman According to Louis Gilrod, at the age of twelve he came to America.At first he was a prompter in Yiddish theatre, then he became a coupletist and was regarded as having achieved quite a high level, and he was in his time a star of concerts.By himself, he used to write both the lyrics and music for his couplets

title: Sonia Kopelman
description: Sonia [Yofe] Kopelman Born in 1903 in Cherkassy, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.Father -- a laborer.In 1910 she went over to Yekaterinoslav with her family, where she received her education

title: Leo Kopp
description: Dr.Leo Kopp K.was born in 1889 in Kremenetz, Volin

title: Moshe Kopp
description: Moshe Kopp He appeared in the wine cellars at the end of the sixth decade of the nineteenth century.He had great (the greatest?) success of all the singers.He used to accompany himself on the harmonica

title: [?] Kores
description: (?) Kores According to the actor David Kessler in his memoirs, K.was [zeyger] a friend from Kishinev, and that Goldfaden had in Odessa (under the direction of Grudsky) staged his play "Di makabeyer" in which Mark Meyerson performed in the role of "Antiokhus", Aba Shoengold -- "Yehuda hamakabi", and Kessler -- "Yozef".According to L

title: Zishe Kornblit
description: Zishe Kornblit Born on 28 September 1872 in Tchan (Teofilpol) Volhynia.Father- Hillel a passionate Zinkiver Chasid, a scholar, and an avid teacher.At the same time a worldly person

title: Berta Kornfeld
description: Berta Kornfeld (Batya Kurier) Born on 23 April 1882 in Slavuta, Ukraine, into a well-to-do family.She received a good education in Yiddish and Russian.Moving to Proskurov, she had learned there in a school, which she completed as a teacher

title: Leon Kornfeld
description: Leon Kornfeld He writes in his life story, sent to the "Lexicon of the Yiddish Theatre," the history of Yiddish theatre in Constantinople, Turkey, where he lived.He remembers that when he was ten years old, there arrived in Constantinople Professor Horowitz with a small group of amateurs in the Galata region, in a cafe house that took in about some one hundred to one hundred and twenty people, without a stage, and without proper sets.They performed "Don Yitskhok Abarbanel," and did some bad business, such that Horowitz simply was hungry

title: Malka Kornstein
description: Malka Kornstein K.was born in April 1899 in Lublin, Poland, into an intelligent family of high standing, where she realized in herself a deep love for publishing the Yiddish word, and she used to from her early childhood recite and read for families and guest creations of the Yiddish writer.After the death of her father, she was "eng gevoren" in her home with her stepmother, and as an eleven-year-old girl she traveled out to Warsaw, where she had a job in a cigar factory

title: S. Kornteyer
description: S.Kornteyer Zalmen Zylbercweig writes: "All efforts to determine the date and place of his birth were not submitted.I think, however, that around 1918 he suddenly appeared in Lodz's Yiddish theatre

title: Esther Kovalska
description: Esther Kovalska M.was born on 3 May 1905 in Suwalki, Poland.Her father was a hairdresser and also a makeup artist in the theatre

title: Matisyahu Kovalski
description: Matisyahu Kovalski (Mates; Koval) K.was born on the 15th of January, 1880 in Lubitz in Minsk Province in Belarus.His parents were flax merchants

title: Etel Kovenska
description: Etel Kovenska Born in 1924 in Zhetl, Grodno Gubernia.Her father was a broker in a forest.She got an inclination for art from her mother's side, whose father was a badkhan [jester], although he was not a professional

title: Philip Krantz
description: Philip Krantz (Yakov Rombro) Born on 13 October 1858 in Zupran, Oshmyany kreyz, Vilna Gubernia.This is according to a birth announcement issued in 1883 from the Kaziana Rabbi--Hirsch Eppel in Zupran.In various biographical notes printed during his life and also after his death, his birth place, according to Zalman Reisen -- was given as the shtetl of Chorok in Podolia into the area which his parents brought him when he was a child

title: Sarah Kranzfeld
description: Sarah Kranzfeld Without a doubt, the first woman who, in 1882, performed Yiddish theatre in New York, America.All the information about her comes from Boris Thomashefsky, who wrote about her several times, but in fact, he changed her story each time, so the accuracy of his information is questionable.In his book, Thomashefsky’s Theatre Writings (New York, 1908), Thomashefsky recounts how, working in a cigar factory, one of the workers, Abraham Golubok, while singing theatre songs, described how his two brothers acted in the London, England Yiddish theatre, and it displayed in an advertisement, on which was written, “the role of Mirele in The Sorceress will be sung and played by the one and only, world-famous Jewish Sara Bernhardt, Madame Kranzfeld” Later, Thomashefsky describes how a well-known man, N.G

title: [?] Krastoshevsky
description: [?] Krastoshevsky According to Jacob P.Adler in his memoirs, K.was born in Shpole, Ukraine, and was "a madim" for singing "Yiddish shtik." A Russian minister had at one time heard him sing, and he had him, on his account, send him to study in a conservatory

title: Solomon Krause
description: Solomon Krause (Shlomo) K.was born on 4 July 1876 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a waiter

title: Leah Krause-Miller
description: Leah Krause-Miller(Loyfland) Leah was born in 1880 in Hrubieszów, Poland.Her parents drew income from a sprays shop.The actor Shlomo Kroyz (Solomon Krause), who later married her, recalls that he had become acquainted with her at a time in Lublin, and that he had been in love with her

title: Bertha Kreitsberg
description: Bertha Kreitsberg (Lesser) K.was born on 24 July 1890 in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was the actor Solomon Lesser; her mother was a milliner

title: Yasha Kreitzberg
description: Yasha Kreitzberg (Saksanski; Saxon) Born on 4 December 1885 in Odessa, Ukraine.He studied in a local conservatory, played various instruments in orchestras all over Europe.He arrived in America in 1922 and shortened his family name to Saxon, but after his marriage he took on the name of Kreitzberg

title: Yitzhak Krelman
description: Yitzhak Krelman Born on 2 November 1896 in Warsaw, Poland.Father -- longtime merchant, owner of a factory for rendering tallow.He completed a school of commerce

title: Betsalel Kremer
description: Betsalel (Sasha) Kremer K.was born in 1905 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.He completed a Yiddish-Polish gymnasium

title: Ida Kremer
description: Ida Kremer K.was born in 1873 in Grodno, Polish Lithuania.She was the sister of Yiddish actor Louis Kremer

title: Isak Kremer
description: Isak Kremer Born in 1912 in Dvinsk, Latvia.In 1930 he performed in the Kharkov Yiddish Theatre for the young workers, afterwards going over to the Kharkov State Yiddish Theatre, with whom he in 1936 toured with to Kiev and was taken into the Kiev State Yiddish Theatre.In 1939 he went into the Baku State Yiddish Theatre

title: Louis Kremer
description: Louis Kremer K.was born on 22 September 1876 in Grodno, Russia-Poland.His parents were of the richest families in the city

title: Yosef Kremer
description: Yosef Kremer K.was born in 1917 in Kharkov, Ukraine.Since 1932 he was an actor in the Kharkov State Yiddish Theatre, and afterwards in the Vinitser State Yiddish Theatre

title: Jacob Kreplak
description: Jacob Kreplak [Yankev] Born in 1885 in Zabludow, near Bialystok, Russian Poland.He was arrested in various cities due to his revolutionary activities, serving in the military in Helsingfors.He had to flee abroad, and he settled in Antwerp, where he worked as a diamond polisher, while at the same time being active in the Jewish cultural social life

title: Max Kreshover
description: Max Kreshover Born in 1892 in Dzhikov, Galicia.Father -- a tavern owner.He learned in a cheder and in a school

title: Miriam Kressyn
description: Miriam Kressyn Born on March 4, 1911 in Bialystok in Polish Lithuania.Her father was a salesman.He could not earn enough to support his family

title: Leon Kristol
description: Leon Kristol Leon Kristol was born on August 10, 1894 in Shargorod, Podolia Gubernia, Ukraine.His parents were artisans.He learned in a cheder, in a private folksshul, and with a teacher At the age of fourteen, he went away to Odessa, where he was an extern and was engaged in teaching

title: Harry Krohn
description: Harry Krohn (Tsvi-Hersh) Born on 3 October 1870 in Odessa, Ukraine, to parents who were flour merchants.He learned in a cheder, and a little with a Yiddish teacher, then in a city school.In the years of his youth, he was friends with the corner singers Sabsey, Perlmutter, Krohn (nisht keyn krub), and he wrote songs for them, such as "Israelik der yetume", "Shreyb mir a brivele", "Farges mikh nist, teyere", that they sung with great success

title: Zalmen Kroyn
description: Zalmen (Kroynshtat) Kroyn K.was born in 189...in Kishinev, Bessarabia

title: Krug
description: [?] Krug According to B.Gorin, it was that when Avraham Goldfaden came to Romania (in 1879) to play in Odessa, there there was a certain cook with the name of Krug.He was known in Peterburg as a city guide, and he was mixed [up] with "Natshalstvo." He prompted himself to find out that Yiddish theatre would be allowed to be performed not only in Odessa, but in the entirety of Russia, and therefore he had required that Goldfaden should make him a partner in the theatre

title: Abraham Kubansky
description: Abraham Kubansky Born on 23 November 1882 in Odessa, Ukraine.He studied in a Russian school.He began to act in his youth in Russia on the Russian stage

title: Leon Kuperman
description: Leon (Yeshaya Arye) Kuperman Born on 24 June 1883 in Iasi, Romania.His grandfather was the R' Mordechai Altschuler, one of the oldest booksellers and antique collectors in Romania.His father was a bookseller, and a publisher and antique collector

title: Samuel Kuperman
description: Samuel Kuperman Born at the end of the eightieth year of the nineteen century in the shtetl Vloshtshave (Włoszczowa), Poland.Parents -- land owners, who became homeless, due to the fact that his father passed away from a heart attack, and K.was raised by an uncle who brought him to Lodz

title: Godl Kurazh
description: Godl (?) Kurazh About his origin, data of his birth, and how he came to the Yiddish theatre, there is no specific information.The musician Herman Fiedler recounts that K.came from Brody, Galicia, but grew up in Odessa

title: Yakov Kurlender
description: Yakov Kurlender (Polish: Jakob) Born on 20 December 1904 in Warsaw, Poland.His parents were artisans.He completed a middle school, and for eight years worked in a book business of A

title: Khaykele Kushnir
description: Khaykele Kushnir Born in 1915 in Vilna, Russia-Poland into a poor family, yuos still was hungry.From childhood she manifested an artistic talent; she took part in the Vilna Yiddish amateur circle and afterwards entered the chorus of the Yiddish theatre.At the age of eighteen she arrived in Riga and went into the Kadish-Khash theatre troupe

title: Leon Kusman
description: Leon Kusman Born on 1 December 1884 in the village of Aleksanderhof, by Mitroy, Courland, where his parents had lived part-time.His father, a grain merchant, was a great grandson of R' Avraham, the Vilna Gaon's brother.As a child of three, he went with his parents over to Zager, where he learned in a cheder, then went over to the town Krup, where he was raised by an uncle

title: Solomon Kustin
description: Solomon Kustin [Shlomo] Born on 10 May 1878 in Grodno, Russian Poland.His father was a clock maker.K

title: Sonia Kustin
description: Sonia Kustin (Kompaneyets) Born in Odessa, Ukraine.Father -- a notary.Sister of one mother with theatre director Adolf Kompaneyets, and daughter of his father's brother

title: Motele Kutsik
description: Motele Kutsik Born in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a Yiddish actor, and soon thereafter disappeared.He completed a "TSISHO" school

title: Leyb Kuznetsov
description: Leyb Kuznetsov Born in 190....His father, who lived to over one hundred years of age and was a blacksmith and a sexton.Also his mother had lodged older types

title: Henry Lachtiger
description: Henry Lachtiger L.was born on 18 January 1888 in Shidlovets, Poland.His parents were merchants

title: Aaron Lager
description: Aaron Lager L.was born in 1869 in Brody, Galicia.His father was a poor hat maker

title: Naya Lakernik
description: Naya Lakernik L.was born in 1907 in Minsk, White Russia.Together with her husband, Nate Tsesarski (born in 1908 in Odessa, a violinist who studied at the Odessa Music Dramatic School), afterwards was in Minsk radio), she performed in 1928 as a young actress in the Yiddish theatre

title: Itzhak Laks
description: Itzhak Laks L.was born on 2 October 1888 in Lipno, Plotz Gubernia, Poland, to Chasidic parents.He learned Gemorah and received a secular education, then he studied painting

title: Sabina Lakser
description: Sabina (Sarah) Lakser Born in 1871 in Iasi, Romania.Her father was the owner of a business that sold wholesale colonial goods.Possessing dancing abilities, she was introduced as a child to the neighboring actor Mogulesko for Goldfaden, who took her in to educate her, left her to study the piano, and she also joined them on a tour of Russia, where she participated in 1879 in the divertissement after the performances

title: Morris Lampe
description: Morris Lampe Born in 1895 in Warsaw, Poland to Chasidic, well-to-do parents.He learned in a cheder.At the age of thirteen he finished a folkshul and began to learn in a business school

title: Chaya Landau
description: Chaya Landau L.was born in 1886 in Blashki (Blaszki), Poland, to Chasidic parents.Her stage career began in Minsk with M

title: Yehuda Leib Landau
description: Dr.Yehuda Leib Landau L.was born on 4 May 1866 in Założce, near Brody, Galicia

title: Zisha Landau
description: Zisha Landau L.was born in 1889 in Plotsk, Poland into a Chasidic family, receiving a traditional Jewish education in a cheder and with tutors.Later he learned Polish and secular studies with a Christian teacher

title: Moshe Landau-Klekoy
description: Moshe Landau-Klekoy L.was born in 186...in Włocławek, Poland

title: Shmuel Landau-Klekoy
description: Shmuel Landau-Klekoy L.was born on 9 August 1882 in Włocławek, Poland.His parents were merchants

title: Leonard Landes
description: Dr.Leonard Landes In America he published various brochures and booklets about society matters with [etsut] about pregnancy [a.d.g.] [Oysnutsndik] the difficult material situation in which Avraham Goldfaden had found himself during his last years in America, L.had written for him a letter of recommendation, which he had later published anonymously in the Yiddish press and also printed as the forward to his booklets about sexual matters

title: Joseph Landis
description: Joseph Landis Born on 24 August 1917 in New York, America.He graduated from the Sholem Aleichem Folks Institute, and in 1940 was an aspirant to YIVO (Yiddish Scientific Institute), and from 1938 until 1940 directed with the Workmen's Circle alumni clubs.1937 -- Bachelor of Arts from New York City College, 1939, there, Master of Science in Education, 1951 received a doctorate in English and American Literature in New York University (NYU)

title: Landman
description: Dr.Landman On 12 October 1917 in Adler's Grand Theatre in New York, there was staged "Der groyser kamf, fun dr.landman, staged by Jacob P

title: Harry Landman
description: Harry Landman L.was born on 13 May 1889 in Dunayev, Galicia.His father was a grain merchant

title: Sarah Lando
description: Sarah Lando L.was born on 20 March 1909 in London, England.Her father was an actor (Yekhiel Lando -- ed.) who later became a restaurant owner

title: Yekhiel Lando
description: Yekhiel Lando L.was born in 1878 in Uzshrib, Radom Gubernia, Poland.In 1896 he immigrated to London, where he began in 1903 to act in the Yiddish theatre

title: Zila Landsman
description: Zila Landsman L.was born on 18 November 1886 in Bendin, Poland.His father was a tailor

title: Henry Morris Landvorth
description: Dr.Henry Morris Landvorth (Moshe Chaim Landvirt) L.was born on 1 April 1886 in Andrikhov, Galicia

title: Harry Lang
description: H.(Harry) Lang L.was born on 14 December 1888 in Shkur, Kovno Gubernia.Lithuania

title: Clara Langsner
description: Clara Langsner :L.was born in 1886 in Skamarak, a hamlet near Butshatsh, Galicia, to very religious parents.Her father--a name in a liquor brewery, there came later a position in the shtetl Monasterzhisk, where L

title: Zokn Zarakh=Paltiel Lantsman
description: Zokn Zarakh=Paltiel Lantsman L.was born in 1866 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a traveler (salesman?) for a lumber firm

title: Rivka Lapis-Volkenshteyn
description: Rivka Lapis-Volkenshteyn (Rita Lilina) L.was born on 21 September 1890 in Glukhov, Chernigov Gubernia.Her father was an employee

title: Yehudis Lares
description: Yehudis Lares(Rivka Hanenzohn) Born in 1882 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania, where she completed the Marinskaya gymnasium and entered into a Russian itinerant troupe with whom she acted for several years until the outbreak of the World War, when the theatres had to cease performing.Then L.returned to Vilna and joined "Fad'a" (later known as the "Vilna Troupe"), which was just founded, and soon she became one of their devoted members

title: Isidore Lash
description: Isidore Lash (Yitzhak Lesh; Izidor Leshtshinski) Born on 6 October 1887 in Kharkov, Ukraine.His father was a teller in the Russian state bank.After his father's death, L., as a three-year-old child, was placed by his mother in Volozhin (Vilna Gubernia), with her father, from whom he received a strong religious upbringing

title: Rebecca Lash
description: Rebecca Lash (Rivka Rosenblum) L.was born on January 1889 in Bucharest, Rumania.Her parents were the Yiddish actors Adolf and Betty Rosenblum

title: Regina Lashkovska
description: Regina Lashkovska L.was born in 1889 in Odessa, Ukraine.Her father was a master tailor

title: Bronya Laska
description: Bronya Laska L.was born on 3 August 1894 in Lodz, Poland.She received an Orthodox education, learned in Yarotshinki's school and in Poznanski's evening school

title: Philip Laskowski
description: Philip Laskowski L.was born on 17 July 1889 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a Radzmin Chasid, a lumber merchant

title: Max Lasky
description: Max Lasky L.was born in 1895 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a sexton

title: Herman Laster
description: Herman Laster L.was born in Stetsov, Galicia.He learned in a cheder and in the Baron Hirsch folkshul in Horodenka and also with a private tutor

title: Izela Latayner
description: Izela Latayner (Gitele Finkelshteyn) Izela Latayner was born in 1860 in Iasi, Rumania.Her father was a broker.She learned in a Romanian Talmud Torah, and through private study acquired the knowledge of some European languages

title: Yosef Latayner
description: Yosef Latayner (Yoisef; Lateiner) Yosef Latayner was born on 25 December 1853 in Iasi, Romania.His father was a tailor who emigrated from Russia.His mother was born in Romania, according to Yitzhak Libresko

title: Berta Latovitsh
description: Berta Latovitsh (Beyla Gurevitsh) L.was born in 1890 in Yekaterinoslav, Ukraine.She is the sister of the actress Miriam Gurevitsh

title: Itzhak Latovitsh
description: Itzhak Latovitsh L.was born in 1889 in Pyastetshna, near Warsaw, Poland.His father was a ritual slaughterer

title: Jennie Lavitz
description: Jennie Lavitz(Shmilovic; Jenna Lovic) Born on 7 April 1912 in Bucharest, Romania, to the Yiddish actors Sammy (Shmuel) and Saltshe Smilovic.She began to act with her parents in children's roles.Undergrown, she began to act on the Romanian stage with Alfred Tonaso, and then in Yiddish troupes with her parents

title: Pepi Lavitz
description: Pepi Lavitz (Plpul) L.was born on 29 March 1880 in Lemberg, Galicia.Her parents maintained costumes for [beler=ballet?] and theatre and also had as his neighbors the acting Treitler family

title: Pinchus Lawanda
description: Pinchus Lawanda L.was born in 1898 in Lodz, Poland, to well-to-do parents.he received a Yiddish and secular education

title: Abraham Lax
description: Abraham Lax L.was born on 16 August 1899 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a Hebrew teacher

title: Chana Lazar-Ingard
description: Chana Lazar-Ingard (Rakover) L.was born in Krakow, Galicia.She studied in Krakow's university

title: Elias Lazarov
description: Elias Lazarov (Eliezer Shafir) L.was born on 10 December 1896 in Kiev, Ukraine.His father was a conductor in the local opera

title: Feige Lazarov
description: Feige Lazarov (Krinitsaya) L.was born in Brusilov, Ukraine.In 1901 she came to America as a child

title: Aaron Lebedeff
description: Aaron Lebedeff (Aron Lebedev) Aaron Lebedeff was born in Homel [Gomel], White Russia.His parents had a clothing business.As a boy he sang with the Homel cantor Barukh David

title: Vera Lebedeff
description: Vera Lebedeff(Rivka Shekhtman) L.was born in November 1899 in Nikolayev, Kherson Gubernia, Ukraine.Her father was the manager of a beer factory

title: Der Lebediger
description: Der Lebediger(Khayim Gutman) L.was born on 13 December 1887 in Petrikov, Minsk Gubernia, White Russia, into a well-to-do family.He learned Tenach and Gemora in a cheder, also Russian and Hebrew

title: David Lederman
description: David Lederman L.was born in Apt (Opatów), Radom Gubernia, Poland, to religious parents, leather merchants.He came over with his parents to Lodz

title: Henni Lehman
description: Henni Lehman L.was born on 11 June 1906 in Alfensdorf, Germany, to Christian parents.Her father was a railroad worker

title: Adolf Lehrer
description: Adolf (Aaron) Lehrer L.was born on 21 October 1888 in Tomaszow, Lublin Gubernia, Poland, to Chasidic parents, merchants.He learned in a Talmud Torah, then with a rabbi from Lodz R' Elihu Chaim Meyzel

title: Zalman Lehrer
description: Zalman Lehrer Born on 18 March 1896 in Chentshin (Checiny), Kielce Gubernia, Poland.His father was a melamed (teacher).L

title: Daniel Leibel
description: Daniel Leibel Born on 20 November 1891 in Dembitz, Eastern Galicia, as the son of a khubbtsion and meshkil.From age four until thirteen, he learned in a cheder in Dembitz and Tarnow, where the family moved to in 1899.Here L

title: David Leibovitsh
description: David Leibovitsh L.was born on 7 December 1892 in Iasi, Rumania.His parents were in business

title: Herts Leibovitsh
description: Herts Leibovitsh Born in Vindoi (Vainode), Latvia.Due to his belonging to the Left movement, iz im oysgekumen year-long zikh tsu matern in tfisut.After the Soviet might overtook Lettland (Latvia), he was placed atop the Yiddish theatre in Riga

title: Moti Leibovitsh
description: Moti Leibovitsh Born in 189...in Romania.He acted in the Romanian Yiddish Theatre together with his wife Tsilya

title: Raytshel Leibovitsh
description: Raytshel Leibovitsh L.was born in 1885 in Bucharest, Romania.At the age of fifteen he traveled to Bukovina

title: Tsile Leibovitsh
description: Tsile Leibovitsh Born 189...in Romania.She acted in the Yiddish theatre in Romania, together with her husband Moti

title: H. Leivick
description: H.Leivick(Leyvik Halpern) Born in 1888 in Igumen (Chervyen), Minsk Gubernia, White Russia.His father was a teacher for reading and writing Yiddish, his mother a baker

title: Bertha Lelchuk
description: Bertha Lelchuk L.was born in Pinsk, Poland.Her father was a businessman

title: S. Lemberg
description: S.Lemberg (Sara Feynshteyn) L.was born on 15 September 1901 in Vitebsk, White Russia

title: Leibush Lensky
description: Leibush Lensky (Ksieski) L.was born in 1912 (according to his gravestone in the smaller Yiddish Theatrical Alliance society plot at Mt.Hebron Cemetery in Queens, New York, he was born on 15 December 1903 [and passed away 2 May 1991 -- ed.]) in Shidlov (Szydłów), Poland, to a father -- a small businessman and an artisan

title: Vampira Leoneska
description: Vampira Leoneska Born in Bucharest, Rumania.A Christian.L

title: Leonid Leonov
description: Leonid Leonov L.was born circa 1920.In 1941 he completed the Moscow Yiddish Theatre School

title: Miriam Lerer
description: Miriam Lerer L.was born in Ludmir, Volin.Her father was a colonist, who soon went off to Argentina

title: Shifra Lerer
description: Shifra Lerer Born in the colony Santa Catalina, Argentina, remote and isolated from the greater Jewish communities, but thanks to the warm attitude of her family, eyngezapt in herself from her early childhood familiarity with Yiddish literature, especially after the family moved to Buenos Aires.At the age of eight years, according to the recommendation of her sister, the actress Miriam Lerer, she began to act in children's roles with the guest-starring Boris Thomashefsky, and she continued along for a certain time.So at the age of ten she participated in Jacob Botashansky's production of L

title: Adela Leresko
description: Adela Leresko (Kerner) L.was born in April 1886 in Lemberg, Galicia.Her father was a second cantor in the city temple

title: Samuel Leresko
description: Samuel Leresko (Shmuel Lehrer) Born on 1 August 1876 [according to Bader's Calendar -- 1868] in Iasi, Romania.Father -- the owner of a bank business.He learned in a religious elementary school [cheder], in a governmental school, and then in a private military school

title: Eliyahu Lerman
description: E(liyahu) Lerman Born in 1899 in Radom, Poland, he learned in a cheder [religious elementary school], and later in a Russian gymnazie [high school], then became a business employee.During the First World War he settled in Warsaw, where in 1918 he began his writing activity with reporting on Jewish life in Warsaw, then he was a co-worker in the Warsaw Yiddish newspapers, "Moment," "Haynt," "Radyo," "Hayntige nayes" and "Unzer ekspres." In these newspapers he published tens of humorous novels, such as "Khasidishe tekhter," "Dinste-meydlekh," "Der yeshiva-bokhur," et al.He also worked with others in the provincial press and edited the weekly "Der soykher" (Warsaw, 1919-1935) in "Di panorame" (Warsaw, 1926-1937)

title: Chana Lerner
description: Chana Lerner L.was born in 1900 in Lodz, Poland, to well-to-do parents.She worked as a "spinstress" in a weaver's workshop

title: Joseph Judah Lerner
description: Joseph Judah Lerner Lerner was born on 13 January 1847 (according to S.Borovoĭ -- 1 January 1849) in Berdichev, Ukraine, to religious parents.Until the age of thirteen he studied Jewish subjects, then he went away to Zhitomir where he attended the gymnasium

title: Maria Lerner
description: Maria Lerner (Miryam Rabinovitsh) Born in 1860 in Berdichev, Ukraine (according to her son -- in Bessarabia) into a prominent family.She completed the middle school in Kishinev.When she was very young she married Y.Y

title: Yakov Lerner
description: Yakov Lerner According to Zalmen Zylbercweig: "There is no biographical information about him, there was no way that I would want to receive.It seems to me like at the beginning of you shouldn't know from it, probably 1908-1909, he suddenly showed up on the Yiddish stage in Warsaw.The theatre directions by which he played had certainly announced him

title: Yeshayahu Lerner
description: Yeshayahu (Shabtai?) Lerner L.was born circa 1879 in Khotin, Bessarabia.The youngster was raised in Beltz, where he then became a teacher of Hebrew and Russian

title: Joseph Lessing
description: Joseph Lessing On 16 June 1918 on the roof garden of the Second Avenue Theatre there was staged by Sam Adler L.'s drama in 3 acts with a prologue "Dos kind fun shturm (The Child of the Storm)" (music by Peretz Sandler).In the play the following actors participated: Nadya Neroslavaska, Jacob, Lisa and Rose Silbert, Madame Brie, Madame Mogulesko, Moshe Simonoff, H' Goldstein, David Pecker, Elihu Tenenholtz, H' Hochstein, Moshe Silberkasten and Sam Adler.According to a notice in the "Forward", Sam Adler resolved, that the play is not L.'s, but that it was written by a Russian Jewish writer Vohlin, a son of a well-to-do Yiddish family in Minsk, and it was staged in 1908 through Adler in Minsk with the participation of Jacob Ben-Ami and Lazar Freed

title: Zygmunt Lev
description: Zygmunt Lev (Asher-Zelig) Born on 15 October 1904 in the Carpathian-Russian village of Yashinitz, Galicia, where there lived only a minyan of Jews, where they had maintained a religious teacher for the children of the village, through which L.had also learned.His father kept a sawmill

title: Feyga Levando
description: Feyga Levando (Levin) L.was born on 22 March 1893 in Odessa, Ukraine.Her father was a manager in Spivak's bakery

title: Avraham Levebrovski
description: Avraham Levebrovski L.was born in 1888 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a governor

title: Leah Levebrovski
description: Leah Levebrovski (Dikhtenberg) Born on 27 April 1891 in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was a minor grain trader.Through a friend she became acquainted with "amateurs," and with them began to act in Yiddish theatre

title: Fannie Levenshteyn
description: Fannie Levenshteyn (Perlman) L.was born in Odessa, Ukraine.Her father was a businessman

title: David Levenson
description: David Levenson L.was born on 15 May 1871 in Riga, Latvia to well-to-do parents.He finished a city school, then attended a real school, sang as a soprano (he was called "Dovidl Mngn'") with Cantor Rozovsky, and he learned to work in silver and bronze figures

title: Jacob Levenson
description: Jacob Levenson L.was born on 15 October 1872 in Terlitsa, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.his father and grandfather were dayonim (assistants to the rabbi)

title: Isidor Levenstein
description: Isidor Levenstein (Efrayim Yitzhak) L.was born in 1879 in Kaptsova (Kopciowo), Suwalki Gubernia, Poland.His father was a businessman

title: Avraham Levin
description: Avraham Levin L.was born on 26 October 1898 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.His father was an optician

title: Chana Levin
description: Chana Levin L.was born on 5 May 1894 in Biala Podlaska, Poland.Her father was a tailor

title: David Levin
description: David Levin Born on 5 May 1883 in the village Ilgetsem (Ilguciems), by Riga, Latvia, to well-to-do parents.At the age of sixteen he immigrated to Africa.There he performed in the chorus of the Yiddish theatre in Capetown (Director--Saul Wallerstein) and soon he crossed over to play roles

title: Harry Levin
description: Harry Levin (Hershl) Born on 3 September 1900, in Bialystok, Poland.His father was a merchant and a community activist.He was raised in an Orthodox home

title: Julia Levin
description: Julia Levin Born in New York, America.Her father Binymain, a cultured activist, and for many years was the director of the "Folksbiene".She received Yiddish-secular education at the Arbeiter Ring (Workmen's Circle) school

title: Lucy Levin
description: Lucy Levin L.was born on 4 July 1906 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.Her father is a chorus singer in the Yiddish theatre

title: Neytan Levin
description: Neytan Levin L.was born on 13 December 1840 in Yekaterinoslav, Ukraine.His father was a cantor

title: Shmuel Levin
description: Shmuel Levin Born circa 1890 in Pulawy, Lublin region, Poland, to poor parents -- merchants on the railroad.He learned until age twelve in a cheder, later in the Lublin yeshiva, but the ennui of the "eating days", drove him out onto the street.L

title: Z. Levin
description: Z.Levin Born in 18 July 1877 in Kelem (Kelmy), Kovno, Lithuania.Father -- a merchant

title: Anna Levine
description: Anna Levine (Levenstein) L.was born in 1885 in Chmielnik, Kielce Gubernia, Poland.Father -- a railroad shipper

title: Abraham Levinson
description: Abraham Levinson Born on 14 August 1889 in Lodz, Poland, into a family of businessmen who come from Lithuania.Until age thirteen he learned in a cheder, at first with Chaim Yakov Krekher (a meshkhil and author of Yiddish and Hebrew books), and then with Itsikl Tsi?ling (author of "Yilkut eretz yisroel").General education received in the trade schools of Zgierz and Lodz, in the gymnasium of New Aleksander and Praga-Warsaw

title: Ana Levinstein
description: Ana Levinstein I.Lyubomirsky characterized her as such [1931]: "She received a complete education in the "Kultur-Lige (Culture League)" theatre studio.She performed at the Kharkov Theatre [bshet men hot im] founded, but she quickly left the theatre

title: Ludvig Levinzon
description: Ludvig Levinzon Born in 1844 (according to Yaakov Dinensohn, in 1842) in Zamosc, Lublin region, Poland, to observant, poor parents.In his youth, he mastered foreign languages, and was renown as an outstanding master of Polish and German.Additionally, L

title: Jennie Levitas
description: Jennie Levitas L.was born on 7 January 1901 in Kiev, Ukraine.Here parents were artisans

title: Morris Levitt
description: Dr.Morris Levitt (Meir-Leib Levitsky) L.was born on 30 June 1881 in Homel, Mohilev Gubernia, White Russia

title: Gershon-Chaim Levner
description: Gershon-Chaim Levner L.was born on 8 January 1864 in Groys-Tokmak (Bolshoy Tokmak), Tavritsh Gubernia, Crimea.He received a traditional Jewish education

title: Jack Levy
description: Jack Levy Born on 10 September 1887 in Warsaw, Poland, to poor, Chasidic parents.He was raised until bar mitzvah by his grandfather.Together with his grandfather traveled as a child to a Chasidic rabbi, and there was a choir boy

title: Julius Levy
description: Julius Levy Julius Levy was an American lawyer.In 1886, when Drojavich and Rosengarten brought Mogulesko’s troop to the U.S., a disagreement broke out among Feinman, Kessler, Edelstein and others about where they should perform.The directors wanted the actors to go on tour to smaller cities, like Chicago, but the actors disagreed and wanted to remain in New York

title: Max Levy
description: Max Levy An owner of a tavern in New York, he used to be called Levi.In 1892 he became (together with Moshe Heine-Chaimovitsh and Adolf Prints) director of the Thalia Theatre, where Thomashefsky performed for the first time as an "amateur", and he remained at the theatre for three years.Later he out-and-out retired and opened a hotel in Rockaway Beach

title: A. Leyb
description: A.[Avraham-Mordechai] Leyb Born on 20 July 1898 in Lodz, Poland.Father -- a melamed

title: Dzh. Leybner
description: Dzh.(Shneur-Zalmen) Leybner L.was born on 28 September 1883 in Pantshe, Rumania

title: A. Leyeles
description: A.Leyeles (Aaron Glantz; Glanz) Born on 1 February 1889 in Vlotslavek, Poland.He was raised in Lodz, where his parents had moved, and where his father (who had from time to time written in "HaMelits") was a teacher in the artisan's Talmud Torah

title: Mark Leyptsiker
description: Mark Leyptsiker Born on 27 September 1897 in Warsaw, Poland into a Chasidic family.He learned in cheders, yeshivas, etc.With hardships he was permitted to pursue his studies, also with a teacher

title: Shmuel Liampert
description: Shmuel Liampert L.was born on 14 September 1888 in Karitshin, Bialystok region.His father was a phonogramer(?) for books

title: Bentsion Liber
description: Dr.Bentsion Liber L.was born on 6 November 1875 in Iasi, Rumania

title: Moshe Liberman
description: Moshe Liberman L.was born in Hush, Rumania.As a child he came to Bessarabia and there learned under the providence of the writer Yehudah Steinberg

title: Menukha Libert
description: Menukha Libert L.was born in 1892 in Odessa, Ukraine.She learned in a gymnasium, and as a child often attended the theatre and fantasized about becoming an actress

title: Sarah L. Libert
description: Sarah L.(Leah) Libert Born on 27 April 1892 in Kutno, Poland, in a well-to-do religious family.Her father was a Torah scholar, multilingual and a "yeshuv" for the Sochachow rabbi

title: Yankev Libert
description: Yankev Libert L.was born in 1874 in Warsaw, Poland, to poor parents --small dealers.He learned only for three years in cheders and already as a child of ten he was given to a Yiddish printer

title: Olya Libert-Lubotski
description: Olya Libert-Lubotski Born in Odessa, Ukraine.She studied in a gymnasium during the Bolshevik Revolution, and disregarded that their house had been confiscated by the powers-that-be.She and her brothers were given to their studies

title: Z. Libin
description: Z.Libin (Israel-Zalman Hurvitsh) Born in November 1872 in Horki, Mohilev Gubernia, Podolia.his father was a religious teacher

title: Paul Libman
description: Paul Libman (Itskovsky) L.was born in Yekaterinoslav, Ukraine.His father was a clothing merchant

title: Yitskhok Libresko
description: Yitskhok Libresko (Liber) Born on 19 November [according to his memoirs -- 30 November.A.S.] 1850 in Iasi, Romania

title: David Licht
description: David Licht (Daniel Frenkel) L.was born on 7 March 1904 in Lemberg, Galicia.His father was the owner of a colonial store

title: Sidney Licht
description: Sidney Licht L.was born in 1884 in Tomaszow, Lublin Gubernia, Poland, to very religious parents.Three years later the family moved to Tishovitz, where he learned in cheders and was self-taught in the Russian, Polish and German languages

title: Moshe Lichtenstein
description: Moshe Lichtenstein L.was born in 1889 in Tukkum, Latvia.He learned in a cheder, then with his uncle, the Tukkum rabbi, and completed a six-class progymnasium

title: B. Lidin
description: B.Lidin (Elihu-Barukh Liverant) L.was born in 1893 in Partshev (Parczew), previously in the Siedlce, now in the Lublin region, Poland

title: Abraham Lieberman
description: Abraham Lieberman L.was born on 28 January 1895 in Poland.He completed a four-class folkshul

title: Basha Liebgold
description: Basha Liebgold Born in Przemysl, Galicia, she began her stage career as a chorus girl in the Galician province.After her marriage to Zalman Liebgold, she became a soubrette, later a prima donna, and in the end she switched to comedy character roles in the troupes (et al.) of Frances? in Czechoslovakia.In general, L

title: Leon Liebgold
description: Leon Liebgold Born in 1911 in Przemysl, Galicia.Parents -- the Yiddish actors Bashe and Zalman Liebgold.Father -- director of Yiddish theatre in Krakov and across the Galician proivnce

title: Zalman Liebgold
description: Zalman Liebgold Born in 1877 in Krakow, Galicia.His father was a merchant with "eyer," a rich owner's house.He became excited about the Yiddish stage, and in 1900 through his younger brother Zelig, he acted in comedic character roles

title: Zelig Liebgold
description: Zelig Liebgold L.was born circa 1875 in Krakow, Galicia.His father was a merchant with eyer

title: Moritz Lieblich
description: Moritz (Itzhak-Moshe) Lieblich L.was born in 18...in Falticeni or Bucharest, Rumania

title: Freydele Lifschitz
description: Freydele Lifschitz Freydele was born in Brooklyn, New York, America.She is descended from a Yiddish acting family (Tsile Urich was her mother's sister), and from childhood she became excited about Yiddish theatre and participated in the children's troupe under the direction of Pauline Winter, where she debuted as "Abigail" in Goldfaden's "Shulamis," and shortly thereafter in the title role.She then acted in children's roles in the Lyric Theatre (directors Anna and Isidore Hollander), the Bronx Art Theatre and Parkway Theatre

title: Hoda Lifshits
description: Hoda Lifshits L.was born in September 1889 in Minsk, White Russia, into a well-to-do family.She is the sister of Esther (Frumkina)

title: Miriam Lifshits
description: Miriam Lifshits (Shumsky) L.was born on 10 January 1887 in Grodno, Polish Lithuania.Her father was a klezmer musician

title: Moyshe Lifshits
description: Moyshe Lifshits [Livshits] (Livshits; Moses Liwschitz) Born on 18 May 1894 in Belaya Tserkov, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.Father -- a melamed (religious teacher).He learned with his father in a cheder, then in a gymnasium

title: Likhtenshteyn
description: Likhtensteyn L.was an assistant regisseur.He was killed in the Riga Ghetto

title: Moses Leib Lilienblum
description: Moses Leib Lilienblum B.was born on 3 November 1843 (according to Sh.Rosenfeld – 1844) in Keidan, Kovno Province in Lithuania/Poland

title: Liliput
description: Liliput (Gabriel-Hirsh Kretshmer) L.was born on 15 May 1883 in Riga, Latvia.He attended a private school and learned Hebrew through his father

title: Lilit
description: Lilit Yekhezkel Kornhelder writes: "She, a poem to me, was Vilna itself.She lived a bit of time in Bialystok, and also took to participating in the artistic group, which Nakhum Tsemakh had founded [e"h] (together with the wife of Meir Eyzenshtat).She had married Benjamin Unterman, who was an actor until the end of the First World War

title: Ola Lilith
description: Ola Lilith (Lola Tsederboym) L.was born on 15 November 1906 in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was a house owner

title: Isidore Lillian
description: Isidore Lillian L.was born on 7 September 1882 in Rzeszow (Reyshe), Galicia, to poor parents.As a child of ten years, he arrived in America, and at the age of sixteen he entered into a dramatic union, and a year later in a Yiddish vaudeville house, where he excelled not only as an actor, but also as a composer of one- and three-act sketches, for which he wrote the lyrics at the same time

title: Lilly Lilliana
description: Lilly Lilliana L.was born in 1915 in Warsaw, Poland.In 1929 she performed in the chorus of the Skala Theatre, while at the same time learning in a gymnasium

title: Paul Liman
description: Paul Liman (Leybovitsh) Born on 22 November 1930 in Bacau, Romania.In 1949 he graduated from a middle school and later graduated from the Bucharest Institute for Theatre and Cinema and became the literary secretary for the state theatre in Galatz (Galati).In 1952 he began to act in the Yiddish state theatre of Bucharest, where he acted from 1955 until 1957, and from 1961 to 1962 in Iasi, where he performed in a range of roles such as in "Der eyngebildeter kranker" and "George danden" by Moliere, the dramatization by Mendeles "Binyamin di driter", "Dos mishpakha grinvald" by Brukshteyn

title: Shlomo Lindenfeld
description: Shlomo Lindenfeld Born on 30 October 1878 in Warsaw, Poland.Father -- housing administrator.He learned in a cheder and in a Russian trade school

title: N.B. Linder
description: N.B.Linder (Natan Blinder) L.was born on 26 May 1885 in Berdichev, Ukraine

title: Henekh Linetsky
description: Henekh Linetsky He may have come from Kamenets-Podolsk.He was a folksinger, and Hurwitz staged his play "Tisa esler", in which L.had participated in a role

title: Linetsky
description: Linetsky L.was born circa 1885 in Yekaterinoslav, Ukraine, to a poor family.He completed a school, then became a tinsmith

title: Isaac Joel Linetzky
description: Isaac Joel Linetzky L.was born on 8 September (30 August, A.S.) 1839 in Vinnitsa, Podolia.His father was the rabbi, a burning Chasid and cabalist-- which had given him a strong, religious upbringing of the Chasidic spirit

title: Adolf Link
description: Adolf Link A German actor.A Christian.On 14 January 191(8) he had acted in Jacob P

title: Anka Lipinsky
description: Anka (Veytzman) Lipinsky L.was born in 1903 in Warsaw, Poland, into a balebatisher family.Due to this fact, that her mother was young when she died, and her father had married for a second time, she was raised by her married sister, as the other second sister and her brother, the actor Itzhak Lipinsky, in 1921 were away in America

title: Yitzhock Lipinsky
description: Yitzhock Lipinsky (Isaac; Isidore) L.was born on 4 July 1893 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a dealer of bookbinding machines He learned in a cheder and in a "real" school

title: Moshe Lipman
description: Moshe Lipman L.was born on 20 February 1893 in Apt (Opatów), Radom Gubernia, Poland, to Chasidic parents.As a youngster of seven he came to Warsaw, where he learned in various cheders

title: Natalia Lipman
description: Natalia Lipman L.was born in 1890 in Kielce, Poland.Her father was a teacher in the local gymnasium

title: Avraham Lipovietsky
description: Avraham Lipovietsky L.was born in 1865 in the colony Sageydak, Kherson Gubernia, Ukraine.His father was a cantor

title: Esther Lipovska
description: Esther Lipovska (Glazer, Volska) Born on 14 February (Esther Taanit) in 1889 in Samara, Russia.Her father was a tailor.As a child or seven she wandered with her parents to Poland, in a town Zdunska Wola, where she learned Yiddish with her father

title: Nakhum Lipovski
description: Nakhum Lipovski L.was born in 1874 in Neshviz, Polish Lithuania, to Orthodox parents.He was left a keylekhdiker orphan at age nine

title: Sasha Lipovski
description: Sasha Lipovski(Simkha Zhelazo) L.was born in April 1908 in Zdunska Wola, Poland.His father was the actor Leyzer Zhelazo, his mother the actress Esther Glazer-Volska (later - Lipovski)

title: Itzhak Lipshitz
description: Itzhak Lipshitz L.was born in 1875 in Slutsk, Minsk Gubernia, White Russia.His father was a provision supplier/estate liverant for the government

title: Yekhezkel Lipshitz
description: Dr.Yekhezkel Lipshitz L.was born in 1883 in Chernigov Gubernia, Ukraine

title: M. Lipson
description: M.Lipson (Mordechai Yavorovsky) Lipson was born on April 7, 1885 in Bialystok, Poland.Until he was fifteen years old he studied in modern cheders

title: Volodya Liptsin
description: Volodya Liptsin According to Dina Feinman, L.was an Odesser.Apparently, in Russia he married Keni Sonyes and prompted in the troupe, where he had also acted

title: Celia Lipzin
description: Celia Lipzin (Pecker) L.was born on 15 September 1900 in London, England.Her father was a musician in the Yiddish theatre

title: Keni Lipzin
description: Keni Lipzin (Kreine Sonyes; Sachar ) She was born approximately in 1856 in Zhitomir, Ukraine.Her father was a drunk, a stagecoach driver.At ten years of age she lost her mother

title: Malka Lisak
description: Malka Lisak L.was born in 1900 in Kreshnevits, Poland.Her parents were in business

title: Annie Litan
description: Annie Litan(Chana Lipman) L.was born in 1912.Her parents were the Yiddish actors Itzhak Latovitsh and Natalya (later) Lipman

title: Abraham Littman
description: Abraham Littman Born on 1 December 1880 in Borisov, Minsk Gubernia, White Russia.His father was a lumber merchant.He learned in a cheder, a Minsk yeshiva, and because of this, that his father passed away when he was young, and his mother, who had married a dark artist, immigrated to America, and L

title: Pepi Littman
description: Pepi Littman(Pesha Kahane) Born circa 1874 in Tarnopol, Eastern Galicia, to poor parents.In her youth, she was a maid in the home of the parents of the future actor Max Badin.Possessing a beautiful voice, she was lured by the Broder Singers, and she performed with them in bars and inns and migrated with them across Galicia and Romania, until she was introduced to conductor Yankel Littman, whom she married in Czernowitz

title: Yakov Littman
description: Yakov Littman L.was born in Hertsa, Rumania.According to Z

title: Yetta Littman
description: Yetta Littman (Zilberman) L.was born on 18 December 1884 in Zlotshev, Galicia.Her parents were bakers

title: Moshe Litvakov
description: Moshe Litvakov L.was born circa 1875 in Cherkassy, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.His father was a melamed (religious teacher)

title: Berta Litvina-Veyshof
description: Berta Litvina-Veyshof L.was born on 28 December 1897 in Simferopol, Crimea, into a well-to-do family.She completed a Russian folkshul

title: L. Litvinov
description: L.Litvinov(Leib Gurevitsh) L.was born on 28 March 1899 in Minsk, White Russia

title: Malvina Lobel
description: Malvina Lobel (Treitler) L.was born on 26 May 1878 in Stanislawow, Galicia.Her father was the theatre director and actor Chaim Benjamin Treitler

title: Solomon Lobel
description: Solomon Lobel (Leybel) L.was born in 18....in Iasi, Rumania, into the well-to-do Leybel family

title: Leo Loew
description: Leo Loew(Moshe Leyb) Born on 15 January 1878 in Volkovisk, Grodno Gubernia, Polish Lithuania.His parents were engaged in business.He received a strong religious education

title: Samuel Lohnfeld
description: Samuel Lohnfeld L.was born in 1878 in Pinsk, Poland.His parents were owners of a paper factory

title: Shmuel-Yakir Londinski
description: Shmuel-Yakir Londinski L.was born on 8 April 1889 in Siemiatycze, near Brisk, Lithuania.Great grandson of a Modzhitser rabbi, he learned in a cheder with his father in the yeshiva of Novominsk (today Minsk Mazowiecki -- ed.), Lomza and in Rameyles class in Vilna

title: Betsalel London
description: Betsalel London L.was born in 1900 in Odessa, Ukraine.Already at the age of ten or eleven he made a "tsurik-kuntsn"

title: Sam Lowenwirth
description: Sam Lowenwirth L.was born on 5 May 1880 in London, England.His parents (born in Galicia) were the owners of a hotel, in which Yiddish actors used to live

title: Efraim Loyter
description: Efraim Loyter Born in 1889 in Berdichev, Ukraine.Father -- a businessman.He learned in cheders, with a private teacher, and in a Vilna gymnasium

title: Regina Lubartovska
description: Regina (Rivka) Lubartovska L.was born on 4 June 1886 in Lodz, Poland.Her father was a tailor

title: Tsilba Lubartovska
description: Tsilba Lubartovska L.was born on 4 February 1878 in Lodz, Poland.Her father was a tailor, a musician who used to study with his two daughters (the others -- the late actress Regina Lyubarotovska

title: Paula Lubelska
description: Paula Lubelska Born in 1902 in Warsaw, Poland, into a musical family.As a child L.acted in children's roles in "Dos yidishe harts" and "Der fremder" in Simon's Passage Theatre

title: Annie Lubin
description: Annie Lubin (Hendzhya Lubniak) L.was born on 14 May 1897 in Lodz, Poland.Her father was a weaver

title: Harry Lubin
description: Harry Lubin (Hershl Loygzalts) L.was born on 5 March 1904 in New York, America.His father was a musician in the Yiddish theatre

title: Leon Lubinski
description: Leon (Leybush) Lubinski Born on 1 May 1903 in Lentshitz, Poland.His father was a Chasid, a partner in a mill.As a five-year-old orphan he went with his mother over to Lodz, where she opened a milk vault

title: Yeshua Lubomirski
description: Yeshua Lubomirski Born in 1884 in the town of Brusilov, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine, into a very poor family.Until the age of thirteen he learned in cheders.Being taken by his father to Kiev, he, since the age of fourteen, began as an auto-didact, to study there according to a program from the then Russian classical gymnasium

title: Jacob Lubotski
description: Jacob Lubotski L.was born on 15 December 1892 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.He learned in a cheder and afterwards completed Cohen's gymnasium

title: Dave Lubritsky
description: Dave Lubritsky L.was born on 21 March 1904 in London, England [a family member states that David's birthday was Mar.22, 1903, and that he was born in Mile End, London, England- ed.] He was Fanny and Goldie's brother

title: Fannie Lubritsky
description: Fannie Lubritsky L.was born in London, England on 7 March 1896 [a family member states that Fanny's birthday was Sept.19, 1891, and that she was born in Russia- ed.] Her father was a prompter in the Yiddish theatre

title: Goldie Lubritsky
description: Goldie Lubritsky Goldie was born on 26 December 1899 in London, England [family member states that Goldie's birthday was Jan.31, 1896, and that she was born in Whitechapel, London, England- ed.] Her father was a prompter in a Yiddish theatre.She studied at school until the age of eight after which she began to play in children’s roles with Adler, making her debut as “Benjamin’s child” in Libin’s “Broken Hearts”

title: Isaac Jacob Lubritsky
description: Isaac Jacob Lubritsky (Eyzik Yankel) L.was born about 1859 in Vishegrod, Plotzer Gubernia, Poland.According to Leon Gottlieb, Lubritsky used to travel from city to city as an entertainer

title: SonIa Ludner
description: Sonia Ludner (Kuritska) S.was born in 1899 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania, into a Chasidic family.Her father was a cantor and a teacher

title: Sam Ludvik
description: Sam Ludvik L.was born on 14 December 1858 in Lemberg, Galicia.His father was a brush maker

title: Shlomo Luftig
description: Shlomo Luftig L.was born in 1880 in Khshanov (Chrzanów), Galicia.From his early youth he acted in Yiddish theatre in Galicia as a chorus singer and actor

title: David Lui
description: David Lui L.was born on 17 September 1887 in Warsaw, Poland.His parents were house owners

title: Chaim Shmuel Lukatcher
description: Chaim Shmuel Lukatcher L.was born circa 1849.His father was a sexton in a small shul

title: Hersh Lukovski
description: Hersh Lukovski L.was born on 25 December 1896 in Starodub, Homel Gubernia, White Russia.His father was a shadkhan who often used to participate in Purimshpieles (Purim plays)

title: Boruch Lumet
description: Boruch Lumet Born 22 May 1898 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a cantor in a small shul where Lumet sang in the choir.After his father’s death he sang in a children’s couplet in various Polish vaudeville houses

title: Arn Lurie
description: Arn Lurie L.was born on 8 October 1882 in Opole, Lublin Gubernia, Poland.His father was a military tailor

title: Lillian Lux
description: Lillian Lux (Burstein) Born in New York in 1922.Her parents came to America from Odessa when they were children.In 1929, her father, who was a Yiddishist and lover of the Yiddish theatre, placed L

title: Binyamin Lyman
description: Binyamin Lyman L.was born in July 1800 in Aran (Orany, Varena), not far from Vilna, Polish Lithuania.As a child of six-and-a-half he went with his family to Vilna, where his father worked ad a cashier in the karabke

title: Sam Lyudner
description: Sam (Shmuel) Lyudner L.was born in 1885 in Wolbrom, Poland, to very religious parents, who moved to Lodz.As a [bn-ikhir], his parents had wanted him to make a [kli-kodesh], and L

title: Chana Macharovska
description: Chana Macharovska (Gekht) M.was born in 1895 in Odessa, Ukraine.Her father was a commissioner

title: Moshe Dovid Macharovsky
description: Moshe Dovid Macharovsky M.was born on 6 May 1888 in Lodz, Poland, to religious, well-to-do parents.He learned in a cheder and from a teacher in the home

title: R. Machnovska
description: R.Makhnovska M.was born in Yanovke, near Odessa, Ukraine

title: Khana Magid
description: Khana Magid (Tsibiya Dorman) M.was born on 7 November 1865 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.Since the age of two she was raised in Peterburg in piety and godliness

title: Aleksander Magidzohn
description: Aleksander Magidzohn M.was born in 18...in Pinsk, Poland

title: Ida Magidzohn
description: Ida Magidzohn (Stone) M.was born in Manchester, England.Her parents were owners of a colonial business

title: M. Maksimov
description: M.Maksimov (II) (Melekh Pokoy; Maks; Pokrowski; Pokoj) Born in 1893 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was the owner of a small box factory

title: M. Maksimov
description: M.Maksimov (Moshe Lotte) M.was born on 30 December 1889 in Warsaw, Poland

title: Leib Malach
description: Leib Malach (Leibl Zaltsman) Born on 27 November 1894 in Vohlin, Radom Gubernia, Poland.His mother, who used the name of her first husband, Malach, passed away when he was ten years old, and his father (Rafael-Mendl Zaltsman, a Jew who was a scholar, an Amshinov Chasid, early on a village religious teacher, then an oilsmith, a horse trader) married a second wife, fully went away from him.From age seven, until age nine, he learned in a religious elementary school (cheder), then for a short time in a house of study (bit-hamedrash)

title: Yoel Leyb Malamut
description: Yoel Leyb Malamut Born on 23 July 1885 in Snitkov, Podolia, into a Chasidic family.He learned with melamdim and in a Beit HaMedrash.At age fourteen he became an orphan, and M

title: F.H. Maley
description: F.H.Maley No biographical dates are known about F.H.Maley

title: Philip Maltz
description: Philip Maltz M.was born on 1 January 1892 in Krasno, Galicia.His parents were renderers(?) for an innkeeper

title: Israel Mandel
description: Israel Mandel (Madzhevitski) Born in 1902 in Radom, Poland, to Chasidic parents.His father, a merchant, passed away at an early age, and he left a widow with eight children.At the age of eighteen, he immigrated with his older brother, who took the name of Mazov, to Toronto, Canada, to his sister who was married to the journalist and showman H

title: M.Sh. Mandel
description: M.Sh.Mandel M.was a teacher of Russian at Yale University (America), who afterwards settled as a [kheratapist] in New Haven, Connecticut

title: Jacob Mandelblit
description: Jacob Mandelblit M.was born on 26 March 1904 in Warsaw, Poland, to poor parents.From age seven until ten he learned in Lublin, where he had moved to

title: Yozef Mandelkern
description: Yosef Mandelkern Mandelkern was born in Bialystok, Poland.He was a writer in the city administrative office.He later immigrated to America, where he played in Baltimore with Thomashefsky

title: Leon Mandeltort
description: Leon Mandeltort M.was born in Warsaw, Poland, to a well-to-do family.Due to military conscription he went away from Poland to Lemberg and there began to participate in the productions of the Broder Singers, then became a prompter in Lemberg's Yiddish theatre

title: Mania Maniela
description: Mania Maniela (Melamed) Born in Warsaw, Poland.Mother -- a midwife.Her sister -- a costumer in a theatre

title: Annie Manne
description: Annie Manne (Ayzenberg) M.was born on 14 January 1868 in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was an epaulet maker

title: Solomon Manne
description: Solomon Manne M.was born cir 1858 in Krakow, Galicia.He worked as an employee in a business with relatives

title: Herman Mannes
description: Herman Mannes Born on 23 April 1895 in Tukum (Tukkum), Kurland (Latvia).His father was a ritual slaughterer.From age thirteen he worked as an employee in private firms

title: Jacob Mansdorf
description: Jacob (Avraham Yakov) Mandsorf(Kelmovitsh) M.was born on 12 January 1902 in Balitz, a village in the Kielce region, Poland.His parents were tenant farmers (or lessees)

title: Mapu
description: Mapu Yona Radinov writes: "Even behind the two rows of continuous wire provisions of the Riga Ghetto, the cruel Nazi tormentors could not extinguish the love of Yiddish theatre, and the Yiddish culture, theatre, music, songs that had become a fixture throughout the poor, crooked little alleys of the Riga neighborhood--the Moscow Forshtat, where the Riga ghetto was found, where the Latvian Jews had been settled for entirely two years.There tens of musicians, singers, artists had settled their creative lives...not infrequently within these frightening ghetto alleys there was heard a Yiddish melody, a Yiddish song

title: Israel Marchevka
description: Israel Marchevka Born in Lodz, Poland, where he began to act in amateur circles.In 1922 he arrived in Paris, together with the "Vilna Troupe," where he had, according to Yekhezkel Kornhendler, performed for the departing Hersh Grossbard.In Paris, M

title: Moshe Marechovski
description: Moshe Marechovski, the Boslever Marshelik Moshe Marechovski lived until he was seventy or eighty years old, in the nineteenth century, and he was known in the Kiev region as the Boslever Marshelik.He came from the town Drobov, Zolotonosha Oyzer, Poltover Gubernia, where his mother lived into her late nineties.From Drobov his family was able to travel to Boslev

title: Chaim Margoles-Davidzon
description: Chaim-(Moshe-Yoel) Margoles-Davidzon He was born on 14 January 1891 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a soap maker.He studied in Hebrew schools, state folks schools, and with private tutors

title: Clara Margolin
description: Clara Margolin (Bleichman) M.was born in September 1893 in Bucharest, Romania.Her parents were the actors Jacob and Betty Bleichman

title: A. Margolin
description: Dr.A.Margolin M

title: Samuel A. Margolin
description: Samuel A.Margolin A ward in the Russian theatre, a regisseur and theatre critic.He worked for a long time with the famous regisseur Yev

title: Zakhariah Margolin
description: Zakhariah Margolin Born on 31 December 1893 in the shtetl Pyasikatko, Yekaterinoslav Gubernia, Ukraine.His father was a expeditor for the rail lines.He completed in Kremenchug the local commercial school, then in 1921, a commercial institute in Kharkov

title: Edward Margolis
description: Edward (Yekutiel) Margolis Born about 1850 in Tiraspol, Ukraine.His father was a merchant who used to purchase from the copper content of the shot up military cigarette cases from the military.He learned in a gymnasium in Odessa, then studied as a dentist, and from there went away to Romania, where he wandered around with gypsy troupes, then he joined in a Yiddish theatre and played with Mogulesco (a scene by M., together with Mogulesco and Aba Shoengold in his role in one of the first offerings of Yiddish theatre in Russia in Shomer's play, "Der diskontist," published in the "Forward" from 19 April 1929.) Later M

title: Yedidya Margolis
description: Yedidya Margolis M.was born 22 September 1884 in the village of Pustiki, Grodno region, Polish Lithuania, into a family of the first Yiddish colonists in the Glilih(?) (Volkovisk region).His father was a lumber merchant, a maskil (cultured, intelligent person)

title: Ber Margolius
description: Ber Margolius Grandson of Berl Broder.Born in 1887 in Zlotshev, Galicia.In 1891 he went with his parents to Sosov, where he completed four classes at the Baron Hirsch school

title: Efrayim Margolius
description: Efrayim Margolius One of the Warsaw romanticists and playwrights from the end of the nineteenth century who was -- according to Dr.Jacob Shatzky -- standing on the threshold of literature and with few exceptions, indeed remained stuck in this corridor.M

title: Eliyahu Margolius
description: Eliyahu Margolius According to Zalmen Reisen, M.in the years of 1886 to 1899 was an assistant editor for the Bucharest "Hivets"[?], afterwards editor of "Dos folksblat" in Iasi.In the trn'd--trn'd years, he issued the "Israelite folks-kalender" and wrote an entire folk song for the theatre repertory of the actors Bleichman, Simovitsh, Groper, Kaner et al

title: Itzhak Margolius
description: Itzhak Margolius M.was born on 8 September 1855 in Podkamin, Eastern Galicia, as the son of Berl Broder.Until age thirteen he learned in a yeshiva and was renowned as a prodigy

title: Elihu Margolius
description: Rabbi Elihu Margolius Born in 1886 in Rumania, he was an assistant editor for the Bucharest "Hyuets".Afterwards he edited "Dos folksblat" in Iasi.Trn'd-Trn'd published the "Izraelitisher folkskalendar"

title: Rosa Margules
description: Rosa Margules M.was born in Fokshan, Romania.Her parents were storekeepers

title: Max Marienhof
description: Max Marienhof Born in 186...in Sitava, Courland, into a merchant family.At the age of sixteen he began to act with "amateurs" in Yiddish theatre in Sitava

title: [?] Marienstros
description: [?] Marienstros One of the first Yiddish actors in America.M.had himself -- according to Boris Thomashefsky-- participated in 1888 in Boston in Goldfaden's offering of "Beyde kuni lemel (Two Kuni Lemels)"

title: Philip Mark
description: Philip Mark M.was born in 1898 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a butcher

title: Peretz Markish
description: Peretz Markish Born on 7 December 1895 in Polonnoye, Volin, into a family of artisans.He received a Jewish education, and until age ten he learned in a cheder.From age nine until eleven he learned with his parents in the town Romanov, then went away from home and until age thirteen was a choir boy with a cantor in Berdichev, later was for several years was an extern in Odessa, where he lived under difficult material conditions

title: A. Markov
description: Dr.A.Markov Born in 186..

title: Moshe Markovitsh
description: Moshe Markovitsh M.was born on 2 February 1892 in Turgel, Rumania.His father was a tailor

title: Joseph Markowitz
description: Joseph Markowitz Born on 4 February 1884 in Fastov, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine, whose parents -- merchants.He hadn't any consistent desire to learn in cheder, and he made "trouble", from which the youths used to laugh..At the age of nine he toured with a cantor, with whom he migrated for three years for Sabbaths in various towns

title: Louie Markowitz
description: Louie Markowitz(Israel-Leib Mordkovitsh) Born on 9 October 1895 in Mogelnitse, Poland.He learned in a cheder and in a Russian state school.He arrived in 1905, together with his family, in America to join his father, Itzhak, who had earlier migrated here and gotten involved in America in the founding of the workers' unions and fraternal organizations, especially for his townsfolk

title: Rudolph Marks
