description: Raisa Solovyova (Vaksman; Medoff) Born in 1888 in Krasnopolye, Mohilev Gubernia, White Russia.Father and grandfather -- cantors.After her father's death, her family settled in Homel, and she became through her brother a member of the Russian operetta troupe of Suslov, continuing in the troupe where she performed in the prominent singing roles

title: Sonie Badkhan
description: Sonie Badkhan (Yisroel Zandrunski) Born 1850 in Bialystok, Poland to poor parents, who had there only child; named him Sonie, a strange name so that no evil eye should recognize him.He studied in a Talmud Torah and later in a secular school, where he was also an assistant.For fourteen years he served as teacher of Yiddish, Russian, German and a teacher of accounting

title: Froyke Sorokin
description: Froyke Sorokin S.was born on 10 July 1898 in Kishinev, Bessarabia.His father was a theatre hairdresser

title: Leon Spatzer
description: Leon Spatzer Born in Brzezany, Galicia.His father was a sexton.His mother sold corn on the streets

title: Betty Spector
description: Betty Spector (Magidovt) Sister of Yiddish writer Yakov Magidov.She came from Odessa to America together with the members of the third party "Am Olam" (cir 1882) and participated in the first Yiddish production with Boris Thomashefsky.Boris Thomashefsky characterized her as such: "She was [by her the first appearance in New York] an intelligent woman, and not long from a Russian gymnasium

title: Leon Spector
description: Leon Spector He came from Odessa to America with the members of the thirty party "Am Olam" [circa 1882] and participated in the first Yiddish productions in New York with Boris Thomashefsky.According to Boris Thomashefsky he wrote him, he: "was [with his first performance] a young, crafty, brave, lively, friendly man, not long out of the Russian university.He was a hibsher student, a hnvdiker, with a large head of kutsherave hair

title: Hersh Spektarov
description: Hersh Spektarov Born on 7 January 1894 in Zlatopol, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.Father -- employee of a land owner.Until age thirteen he learned in a cheder, and then with his family settled in Yelisavetgrad, where he became an errand boy in a manufacturing store

title: Leybush Spitalnik
description: Leybush Spitalnik Born in 188....in a village near Sharivke, not far from Proskurov, Podolia, into a Chasidic well-to-do family.He became an orphan in his fifth year, and his pious grandfather was his first rabbi, with whom he learned Chumash, Rashi, and later Gemora

title: Jonah Spivak
description: Jonah Spivak He came from Rumania.When he was young he came to America and maintained a pub on Eldridge Street in New York.To attract guests to his pub, he managed the pushcart stalls and carriages for the street vendors, in the background for his pub in a hall (may) where he put away tishlekh un benklekh and there was one of the first Jewish vaudeville houses in New York

title: Yakov Spivakowski
description: Yakov Spivakowski Spivakowski was born on 25 December 1852 in Bucharest, Romania.According to Y.Riminik, Spivakowski was the son of a rich Mohilev tea merchant, and also was a student in the Zhitomir rabbinic school

title: Mathilda St. Claire
description: Mathilda St.Claire [Mantiband] Born in Lodz, Poland.Father -- a manufacturer

title: Harris Stambulka
description: Harris Stambulka Born on 15 July 1876 in Warsaw, Poland.Father -- owner of a print shop.He learned in a cheder and sang in synagogue together with the future actors Adolf Berman, S

title: Starkevitsh
description: Starkevitsh S.was a prompter.He was killed with his wife in the Riga Ghetto.

title: Harry Starr
description: Harry Starr Born in 18...in Kutno, Poland.Raised in London and from there immigrated to South Africa, where he acted in Yiddish theatre

title: Leon Stav
description: Leon Stav (Herbst) Born on 1 October 1901 in Rzheshov, Galicia.His father was a businessman.He completed a gymnasium and the philosophy facultat in Jagiellonski University in Krakow

title: Adolf Stein
description: Adolf Stein S.was born in 1886 in Czernowitz, Bukovina.His father was a small businessman

title: Gitel Stein
description: Gitel Stein Gitel was born in New York, America.Her father was a native of Istanbul (Turkey), was a captain on an English ship, studied to become an engineer in Palestine, Egypt and England, and finally settled in America, where he found employment as a machine engineer.She studied through high school

title: Shlomo Steinberg
description: Shlomo Steinberg Shlomo Steinberg was born in 1891 in Sveksna, Kovno Province, Lithuania.His Father was a teacher.In his youth, he learned in the Skadvile Yeshiva (located north of Sveksna)

title: Harold Sternberg
description: Harold Sternberg Born 22 October 1909 in Odessa, Ukraine.Father, "Yosele Bass," a chazan, sang in the troupes of Fiszon and Sabsey.At the same time conducting with the chorus

title: Avraham Stober
description: Avraham Stober Born in 1908 in Warsaw, Poland, into a merchant family.Because of this, that his parents passed away early on, he had to at the age of thirteen go to work so that he could dergern.He worked as an errand boy in a large Warsaw trading firm, and in the evening he learned in a trade school

title: Tsili Strashun
description: Tsili Strashun Sh.Blakher writes about her: "A yearlong chorister from the Vilna Yiddish Theatre.She was at home in the entire operetta repertoire, both Yiddish and European

title: Morris Strassberg
description: Morris Strassberg He was born in Lemberg, Galicia, on 11 April 1897.His parents were strictly Orthodox.When he was five years old his father died

title: Sonia Strelska
description: Sonia (Sophie) Strelska Born circa 1874 in Novograd Volynskij (Zvihl?), Volin.Father -- a cantor.She received a traditional education and learned with melamdim and with a private teacher

title: Max Streng
description: Max Streng Born on 20 June 1876 (according to Julius Gutman: 1874) in Lemberg, Galicia.His father delivered bread and went away with his wife when S.was a child

title: Avraham Strizover
description: Avraham Strizover Born circa 1893 in Eastern Galicia.He acted and was an assistant director in the "Freye yidishe folks-bine" in Austria and participated in the tours of local troupes in Rumania, committed suicide in January 1923 in Kishinev.According to Jacob Mestel, S

title: Strokover
description: (?) Strokover Avraham Fiszon recalls in his memoirs: "The entire time I did not calm down and sought a girl with a voice, who may have a feeling for singing.Also the other four from our troupe, m'shtayn said, did not rest, and where we came from we were blessed, that perhaps we may search and find a prima donna for the Yiddish stage, and we just found in a small town in Brailov.She was a beautiful young girl, a sister-in-law of the Brailov rabbi, that is, his wife's sister

title: Chana Stromberg
description: Chana Stromberg Born in Braslov, Podolia Gubernia, Russia.She was descended from a theatrical-musical family.Her father possessed a beautiful voice, a love of singing, [gehlumt] to become a cantor, but....

title: Yosef Strugatsh
description: Yosef Strugatsh (Jozef Strugacz) Born on 23 March 1893 in Odessa, Ukraine.Father and grandfather -- cantors.He learned in msuknim cheders, and at the age of fourteen arrived in Belz to his grandparents

title: Nakhum Stutchkoff
description: Nakhum Stutchkoff (Stutshko) Born on 7 June 1893 in Brok, Lomza region, Poland to Chasidic parents who in 1900 moved the family to Warsaw.Here he received a traditional Jewish education.Until age ten he learned in cheders, and until age sixteen in the yeshivas of Lomza, Warsaw, a Volkovysk kibbutz, etc.

title: Moshe Surits
description: Moshe Surits Born on 21 August 1888 in Dvinsk, Lettland (Latvia), to pious parents -- small industrialist.Father -- used to in his youth participate in "The Sale of Joseph plays," so that there was created a fund for a new sefer torah.He learned in a cheder and yeshiva, then completed six classes in the Dvinsk Hebrew school of "Mfitsi Haskalah." From childhood on he manifested a desire for the theatre and participated in the children's productions of the school, Besides this, he used to in an earlier time "act" in private dwellings with children "Captain Dreyfus," and other "plays" for a groshn or a kopek a ticket

title: Rosa Leah Surits
description: Rosa Leah Surits (Levius) S.was born in 1890 in Dvinsk, Latvia.Her father was a traveler

title: Susan
description: Susan (Tsirl Goldenberg) Born on 10 August 1902 in Iasi, Rumania.Due to the death of her mother she was educated with a grandmother.She learned in a folkshul, also Yiddish

title: Nathan Swerdlin
description: Dr.Nathan Swerdlin S.was born on 4 December 1907 in Kupishok, Kovno Gubernia, Lithuania

title: Isaac Swerdlow
description: Isaac Swerdlow (Sverdlov, Swerdloff, Sverdloff) Born in Odessa, Ukraine.His parents were not well-to-do.He studied in a cheder and then graduated from a local state school

title: Sara Sylvia
description: Sara Sylvia (Goldstein) S.was born on 18 May 1893 in London, England.Her father was a chorus singer in the Yiddish theatre in America, later moving to South Africa, where he took up with shoemaking

title: Avraham Tabak
description: Avraham Tabak T.was a chorus singer in Fishzon's troupe, where afterwards he was a prompter.He passed away in poverty in Odessa under Denikin's government, where he was forbidden to perform in Yiddish theatre

title: M.I. Tabakschneider
description: M.I.Tabakschneider T.was born in 1893 in Warsaw, Poland

title: Aaron Tager
description: Aaron Tager T.was the head of a group of folksingers in Odessa (Jacob Katzman, Mendele Abramowitz, Shrage and Boris Altman), and when Spivakovski and Israel Rosenberg put together their troupe for Odessa (1879), they took him in to it.Later he became a prompter in the troupe of Naftali Goldfaden and from time to time also he acted in small character roles

title: Samuel Taksa
description: Samuel Taksa T.was born in 1907 in Rovno, Volin.His father was an employee

title: Nina Talini
description: Nina Talini (Vinokur) She was born in 1901 in Kovno, Lita.Her grandfather was a rabbi.She learned to read Yiddish during her childhood

title: Kh. Tamarkin
description: Kh.Tamarkin T.was born in 1915

title: David Tanentsap
description: David Tanentsap T.was born in 18...in Kolomea, Galicia

title: Sholom Tanin
description: Sholom Tanin (Tankus) T.was born on 12 October 1892 in Grodno, Polish Lithuania.His father was a construction worker

title: [?] Tankel
description: [?] Tankel A fine actress, she produced very fine types and characters in the play, which she acted in the "PIAT" Theatre.She especially excelled in Leivick's "The Poor Kingdom" and in Kulbak's "Boytre." As the Germans grew, she shared the tragic fate that millions of Jews under the Nazi rule.Sh

title: [?] Tantshuk
description: [?] Tantshuk T.was born in Odessa, Ukraine.He had a university education, was a contributor to the Russian press

title: Avraham Itzhak Tanzman
description: Avraham Itzhak Tanzman (Abraham Isaac) R.was born in 12 November 1857 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a businessman and a glove manufacturer

title: Berta Tanzman
description: Berta Tanzman (Berlin) T.was born in 1856 in Riga, Latvia.Her father was a tailor

title: Joseph Tanzman
description: Joseph Tanzman T.was born on 16 October 1886 in Warsaw, Poland.His parents were the actors Avraham Itzhak and Berta Tantsman

title: Henry Tarlo
description: Henry Tarlo T.was born on 5 February 1898 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a [garbarzh]

title: Moshe Tarlowsky
description: Moshe Tarlowsky (Morris) M.was born in 1892 in Lemberg, Galicia, to pious parents.His brother was called "Hershele actor"

title: Ruth Taru
description: Ruth Taru (Reyzl Tukhmakher) T.was born in 1906 in Warsaw, Poland, to progressive parents.Her father was a metal worker, active in the "Bund" under the pseudonym of "Leybush Metalovitsh"

title: Irving Taub
description: Irving Taub T.was born in 1897 in Lodz, Poland.His father was a tailor

title: Harry Tchaikovsky
description: Harry Tchaikovsky (Hershl Chiakovsky) T.was born on 8 December 1889 in Kaminka, Tavaritsh Gubernia, Crimea.His father was a grain merchant

title: Adolf Tefner
description: Adolf Tefner T.was born on 13 February 1908 in Chernalitsye (Czernelica), Galicia.His father was a "vinkl-shreyber (corner-writer)"

title: Wolf Tefner
description: Wolf Tefner T.was the brother of the actor Karl and Adolf.He also acted on the Yiddish stage in Romania, and in 1942, during the evacuation, went to Samarkand

title: Abraham Teitelbaum
description: Abraham Teitelbaum (=Sholem, Sam) T.was born on 1 March 1889 in Warsaw, Poland, to Chasidic, not well-to-do parents, who had a restaurant, where Yiddish actors used to have rehearsals from time to time.Until age sixteen he learned in cheders and yeshivas, and secular studies privately

title: Anna Teitelbaum
description: Anna Teitelbaum (Chana Teitelboym) Born on 9 November 1896 in Berlin, Germany.Her father was a tradesman.As a six-months-old child, she was brought to Paris where she later graduated from school

title: Chana Teitsh
description: Chana Teitsh She was born in 1907 in Rezekne, Latvia.Her father was a ritual slaughterer (shochet), and her brother was a cantor in the Zaylin Synagogue in Riga.He also was interested in music and sang in various synagogues in Riga

title: Elihu Tenenholtz
description: Elihu (Alex) Tenenholtz T.was born on 17 February 1890 in Oziran (Ozeryany), Voliner region.His parents were wool merchants

title: Mendel Teplitzky
description: Mendel Teplitzky He was born on 10 June 1866 in Odessa, Ukraine.His father was a grain merchant.As a child for ten years he worked in Nikolayev and a wine business

title: Kalman Tepper
description: Kalman (Kolya) Tepper T.was born in 1879 in Odessa, Ukraine, into a family of intelligentsia.He received a good Jewish education and completed a course of general studies

title: Jacob Terr
description: Jacob Terr Born on 30 October 1861 in Neyshtot, near the Polish-Prussian border.His father was a businessman, who until age thirteen had let him learn in cheders, then was sent to the yeshivas of Slonim and Grodno.At the age of seventeen he married and was called to further learning, and then he took to commerce, In 1880 he immigrated to Rostov, and here until 1890 he maintained a Hebrew-Russian school

title: Moshe Teykh-Ganzik
description: Moshe Teykh-Ganzik T.came from Galicia and there was a Broder singer, participating in the group of Moshe Kop.As he had bought gas (petroleum), people called him "Gaznik"

title: Moshe Teyman
description: Moshe Teyman T.was born in 1889 in the village Kvasev, Volin Gubernia, Poland, to a religious family.He learned in a cheder in a nearby village and then with a tutor in his home

title: Moshe Teytsh
description: Moshe Teytsh T.was born in July 1882 in the settlement Vartatsy, not far from Mikhalishok and Vornyan, Vilna region, Polish Lithuania.His father was a cultured man, and he was allowed to permitted to bring to him the children's other teacher from Vilna to learn Hebrew, Tenach, a little Gemorah, Russian and German

title: Sidy Thal
description: Sidy Thal Born on 8 September 1909 in Czernowitz, Bukovina.Her father owned a bakery.Even while in school, she was already a good singer

title: Annie Thomashefsky
description: Annie Thomashefsky T.was born on 2 March 1885 in New York, America.She is the sister of Boris

title: Bessie Thomashefsky
description: Bessie Thomashefsky (Brukhe Baumfeld-Kaufman) Born [according to T.alone] in the Winter of 1873 in Tarasche, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.Her father was Shlomo Baumfeld, a merchant, a Talner Khasid, She learned in a cheder

title: Boris Thomashefsky
description: Boris Thomashefsky (Baruch-Aaron) Born in 1886 in Ositniashke, a village in Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.Raised in the nearby location of Kamionke (Kamenka), where his grandfather was the city's cantor.Father -- a cantor, later an actor and playwright in America

title: Harry Thomashefsky
description: Harry (Hersh-Yonah) Thomashefsky T.was born on 21 March 1895 in New York, America.His parents were Bessie and Boris Thomashefsky

title: Mike Thomashefsky
description: Mike (Mordechai) Thomashefsky T.was born on 21 March 1873 in Asidniosky, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.He was the brother of Boris

title: Pincas Thomashefsky
description: Pincas Thomashefsky Born circa 1842 in Talne, Ukraine.His father was a cantor, at first in Talne ("The Talne chazzan"), then in Kamionka (Kamenka).Was very pious in his youth, had graduated from the rabbinate, a musician, was a prayer leader with the Brodskys, with whom he was employed in a sugar factory

title: Matias Thur
description: Matias Thur T.was born in 18...in Lemberg, Galicia

title: Yakov Tikman
description: Yakov Tikman T.was born on 2 February 1890 in Zhitomir, Ukraine.His father was a well-to-do businessman, a meshkil

title: Adolf Timianoff
description: Adolf Timianoff(Timianko) T.was born on 15 July 1886 in Lodz, Poland.His father was Mordechai the Badkhan

title: Mordechai-Chaim Titelman
description: Mordechai-Chaim Titelman T.was born in 1872 in Warsaw, Poland.His parents were merchants

title: Anna Toback
description: Anna Toback (Hannah Tabak) T.was born in June 1905 in New York, America.She learned in public school and Yiddish in the home of a tutor

title: Samuel Tobias
description: Samuel Tobias (Shmuel Tabatshnikov; Tabachnikoff) T.was born in 1861 in Kamenets-Podolsk, Ukraine.As a youth he was a choir boy and was counted as an education person

title: Aleksander Tokman
description: Aleksander Tokman The details of his origins are unknown.It is only known that he was educated in a children's home.In 1935 T

title: G.V. Tombak
description: G.V.Tombak T.was born in 1907 in Zhitomir, Volin

title: Samuel Tornberg
description: Samuel (Shmuel) Tornberg Born in 1872 in Lodz, Poland.His father was a bridge builder.He learned in the old city Beit HaMedrash

title: Chaim Towber
description: Chaim Towber (Tauber, Toyber) T.was born on 14 June 1901 in Mohilev Podolsk, Ukraine.His father was a poor tailor

title: Chaim Toybenshlag
description: Chaim Toybenshlag T.was born on 6 September 1894 in Brest-Litovsk, Poland.His father was a teacher (melamed)

title: Arthur Tracy
description: Arthur Tracy Tracy was born on 22 June 1900 in Kamenets Podolskiy, Ukraine.At the age of six-and-a-half, he immigrated with his family to America.After high school, Tracy organized student performances, for which he had adapted plays and acted in them in the main roles

title: Yakov Shmuel Trakhtman
description: Yakov Shmuel Trakhtman Born ...1831 in Ovruch, Volin.Since 1863 he lived in Odessa, where he was an employee with Brodsky

title: Tsalik Treger
description: Tsalik Treger He was born in 1913 in Odessa, Ukraine.In 1934 he performed in the State Yiddish Theatre in Baku.He was murdered at the hands of the Nazis.

title: Shimen Treibush
description: Shimen Treibush (Samuel) Born on 14 January 1898 in Pinsk, White Russia, to not well-to-do parents.His father was a butcher, who orphaned him for three-and-a-half years.He was raised by his mother (killed by the Nazis together with a son)

title: Chaim Benjamin Treitler
description: Chaim Benjamin Treitler T.was born in 1853 in Stanislawow, Galicia.From childhood on he was a choir boy for Cantor Frilinger and was known as a beautiful student and good singer

title: Avrom Trepel
description: Avrom Trepel He was born in 1908 in Minsk, White Russia.His father was an employee.From childhood he manifested a tendency to copy comical types, and already at the age of eleven he had written a "play" known as "a tragedy of a Jewish family", which he "put on" with youths from the cheder on an improvised stage by themselves at home

title: Nosen Treystman
description: Nosen Treystman(Nakhemya) T.was born in 1896 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was an employee in a crops business

title: Ilya Trilling
description: Illya (Simon) Trilling T.was born on 2 May 1895 in Elberfeld by the Rhine, Germany.His parents were the Yiddish actors Herman Berman and Miriam Trilling, with whom T

title: Manya Trilling
description: Manya (Miriam) Trilling T.was born circa 1875 in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was a furnace worker

title: Chaya Trokiner
description: Chaya Trokiner T.was born in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.She was a co-worker in the theatre "Meydis" as a songstress and managed (oysfirerin) for the texts

title: Leybl Troyanovski
description: Leybl Troyanovski T.was born in Warsaw, Poland, where he participated in the local dramatic circle.In the late twenties he came to Paris, where he joined the dramatic circle with the local "Kultur-LIge (Culture League)," later performing in the "PIAT" Theatre

title: Chana Troyman
description: Chana Troyman (Kats) T.was born on 16 March 1894 in Warsaw, Poland.In 1910 she traveled to Paris, where she began to act in an "amateur" group under the direction of Mark Arnstein, performing as "Bentshik" in Jacob Gordin's "Skhith"

title: Leib Troyman
description: Leib Troyman T.was born on 16 August 1887 in Rogova, Lithuania.His father was a ritual slaughterer

title: David Tselmeister
description: David Tselmeister According to Grisha Rotstein, in Warsaw on Elektoralna Street, Ts.with a brother had a men's ready-made clothing business.His wife was the best sheitel (wig) maker before the face of the pious Jewish women and had a small factory on Bielanska Street, where she was also the owner of a house

title: Rina Tselzar
description: Rina Tselzar (Zeligson) The writer Mark Rzaumni relates: "According to the appointment of the direction [of the Riga Yiddish Theatre], I adapted Mark Arnstein's "Vilner galebesl," creating thereof a musical drama with a main role especially for two artists who were engaged there in the theatre: the singer Khaim Shelkan and the singer Rina Tselzar.She was a young person, a very talented singer (the family was religious).She performed in operetta theatre in Vienna, from where she, after the "anschluss," escaped, returning to her home city in Riga

title: Tsesarski
description: Tsesarski Finished the Odessa Yiddish Theatre studio and was killed in the Minsk ghetto.Sh.E

title: Isak Tsesin
description: Isak Tsesin He was a composer for the Vinnitsa-Zhitomir State Yiddish Theatre.He was shot by the Nazis.Sh

title: Henrik Tseyzl
description: Henrik Tseyzl Born in 1914 in Brody, Galicia.He was educated in Lemberg where he completed the gymnasium in 1932.He began to work as an assistant stenographer with Prof

title: Avram Tshetshelnitski
description: Avram Tshetshelnitski T.was born in Uman, Ukraine.In 1934 he entered the Kiev State Yiddish Theatre for young audiences

title: Yankev Tsibulevsky
description: Yankev Tsibulevsky Born in 1902 in the town Zhivatov, Kiev region, Ukraine.Received a traditional Jewish education, so that until the age of fifteen Ts.only learned Gemora and the holy tongue

title: Yakov Yonah Tsimbler
description: Yakov Yonah Tsimbler (Dimant) T.was born in 1861 in Falticeni, Rumania.He acted on a cymbal (tsimbl), also composed many songs, which he used to sing solo, as he toured across Rumania, and in the tea houses, in which he used to perform, the price to enter was five banes

title: Berl Tsimlikh
description: Berl Tsimlikh He was born in Warsaw where he acted in a dramatic circle.At the end of his twenties he went to Paris.He worked by day, and during the evening acted in a drama, afterwards joining "PIAT." He acted there in character roles, e.g

title: Leah Tsimlikh
description: Leah Tsimlikh Born in Warsaw, Poland.Neighbor of dramatist Mark Arnstein.She acted in a dramatic union in Warsaw, and after settling at the end of her twenties in Paris, she worked by day, and in the evening acted in a dramatic circle and afterwards she performed with the "PIAT" Theatre, where she participated in a large portion of the actor's repertoire

title: Israel Tsinberg
description: Israel Tsinberg Born in 1873 in a village near Lonovits, Volin.His father was a well-to-do [pakhter], an author and a follower? [farerer] of Spinoza.T

title: Yis'roel Yitskhak Tsipershteyn
description: Yisro'el Yitskhak Tsipershteyn Born in 1875 in Beretshin, near Slonim, Poland.In his younger years, T.was a badkhan, and also played Yiddish theatre for which he also wrote songs and couplets

title: Fanya Tsipkina
description: Fanya Tsipkina Born on 3 April 1905 in Minsk, White Russia.Father -- a dentist; mother --a midwife.Until 1922 she learned in a gymnasium, then in a Soviet school

title: Aneta Tsipkus
description: Aneta Tsipkus (Ite Foygl) Born in 1865 in Berdichev, Ukraine, the family would soon go over to Odessa, where the father was a military tailor, a "podriatshik." Due to anti-Semitism, he got a heart attack and shortly thereafter died.At the age of twelve Ts.played a child's role in Yiddish theatre and took to it so much, that eventually she continued to play in children's roles, and her earnings helped the need at home

title: Mindl Tsukerman
description: Mindl Tsukerman (Shnap) According to Yitskhok Libresko, she was born in Bucharest, Romania.Her father was called Aaron Shnap, and he was born in Rimelev, Galicia, and could learn.According to Itsikl Goldenburg, he was a great scholar and merchant

title: Louis Tsvibel
description: Louis Tsvibel According to Goldenburg, he was born in 1862 in Faltishan (Falticeni), Romania.His father was killed at a young age, and he was raised by a stepfather, an owner of a 'lumber camp'.Apparently he had very early immigrated to America and here joined the Yiddish theatre as a prompter

title: Mordechai Tsvit
description: Mordechai Tsvit Born in 1913 in Kishinev, Bessarabia.His father was a tailor.As a child of seven, he already had sung with a cantor

title: Morris Tuchband
description: Morris Tuchband T.was born in March 1886 in Warsaw, Poland.His parents were buyers

title: Lisa Tuchman
description: Lisa Tuchman (Keydan) T.was born on 15 August 1891 in Dvinsk, Latvia.Her parents were owners of a [bakaley] shop

title: Miriam Tufman
description: Miriam Tufman (Pakentreger) T.was born on 12 April 1890 in Unieva, Kalish Gubernia, Poland; when she was young she became an orphan and was raised by her grandfather.She learned in a Polish school, then in a cheder

title: Yehoshua Tufman
description: Yehoshua Tufman T.was born on 15 August 1893 in Amshinov (Mszczonów ), Poland.His grandfather was a lumber merchant and a badkhan

title: George Tuller
description: George Tuller (Zalmen Toler) T.was born on 24 July 1894 in Uman, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.A distant relative of Mischa Elman

title: Herman Tunis
description: Herman Tunis (Chaim-Hersh Ovend) T.was born on 14 October 1900 in Bzhezhani (Brzeżany), Eastern Galicia.His father was the owner of a guesthouse, where Broder Singers used to perform

title: Der Tunkeler
description: Der Tunkeler(Yosef Tunkel) Born in 1881 in Bobruisk, White Russia.His father was a religious teacher.He received a Jewish education, and T

title: David Turevski
description: David Turevski T.was born in 1914 in Romne, Ukraine.From 1932 he worked in the Moscow State Yiddish Theatre in grim-parykmakher-tsed

title: Jonas Turkow
description: Jonas Turkow Born on 15 September 1898 in Warsaw, Poland, to well-to-do parents.The first education he received was at home, then he learned in Warsaw's real gymnasium, in Krinski's trade school, in Dr.Young's oyber-real school in Hungarian Brod (mern), and stage art in the dramatic courses of Professor Rosenbaum

title: Mark Turkow
description: Mark Turkow T.was born on 11 May 1901 in Warsaw, Poland, to well-to-do parents.He was the brother of Zigmunt and Jonas

title: Rachel Turkow
description: Rachel Turkow T.was born on 10 January 1908 in Warsaw, Poland.She is the sister of Zygmunt, Jonas, Itzhak and Mark

title: Zygmunt Turkow
description: Zygmunt Turkow Born on 6 November 1896 in Warsaw, Poland, to well-do, parents of means.He learned in a cheder, then in the Russian school of Muravlov, and later he completed six classes of Krinski's trade school.As a child he excelled in painting and carving., but his main interest manifested in the theatre

title: Yakov Turovsky
description: Yakov Torovsky T.was born in 1888 in a village near Kremenchug, Ukraine.His father was a sexton and merchant

title: B. Tursh
description: B.Tursh T.was a Warsawer, an owner of a printing press

title: Yeshaya Uger
description: Yeshaya Uger U.was born in 1873 in Horoshki, Volin, into a family to whom Rabbi Akiva Eiger was the Messiah.He was educated in Zhitomir, where with his parents in the home he learned Mendele, Binshtok, Tsveyfel, Kulisher

title: Hans Unterkisher
description: Hans Unterkisher Among the members of the German "Irving Place Theatre", which Maurice Schwartz had attempted to [aribertsyen] in his Yiddish troupe, which had taken over the theatre, the Christian-German actor Hans Unterkisher was found, who on 28 November 1918 performed there as "Apollo" in the production of Jacob Gordin's "Sappho" with Berta Gerstin in the title role.B.Gorin writes: "There debuted [nokh] other Germans at the Irving Place Theatre, but they acted in German, and, when Rudolph Kristian, they did not accept Yiddish theatre." B

title: Pepi Urich
description: Pepi Urich (Pearl) Born on 3 August 1908 in Lemberg, Eastern Galicia.Her parents were the Yiddish actors Shamai and Tsile Urikh.Pepi completed a German-Polish school in Krakow

title: Sammy Urich
description: Sammy [Shamai, Gedalyahu] Urich Born on 28 December 1882 in Lemberg, Eastern Galicia.His father was an employee in a manufacturing business, then he became independent.He learned in a cheder and in a yeshiva from R' Shmuel Kalish

title: Tsile Urich
description: Tsile Urich (Khaya Tsile Feder) Born on 22 December 1887 in Lemberg, Eastern Galicia.Parents -- small dealers.At the age of seventeen, she began to act with "amateurs," with whom she acted for a year's time

title: Gava Vai
description: Gava Vai (Grunya Vaynstok) Born circa 1905 in Brisk, Polish Lithuania, where she continuously lived with her family.She debuted in a local amateur group under the direction of Misha Sarver, then was a professional actress in the troupe of Julius Adler.According to Jonas Turkow, she was touring for a long time with him and his troupe across the province

title: Yosef Vakhtel
description: Yosef Vakhtel V.was born in Odessa, Ukraine.He began his stage career in Shomer's troupe in southern Russia, and after [farvar: truly] in the Yiddish theatre in Russia he went in 1883 to London where he acted for a short time and traveled from there with Zilberman's troupe (Zilberman and his wife, Chaimovitsh and wife, Karp, Barodkin and his wife and Lateiner) to America, where he acted for a certain time in comedic roles

title: Berl Vaksman
description: Berl Vaksman V.was an old administrator for the Yiddish theatre.He worked entirely in Yiddish theatres

title: Ester Vaksman
description: Ester Vaksman She was born on 25 July 1874 in Lodz, Poland.Sister of Moshe David Vaksman and Fannie Vaksman-Blumental.In 1900 she came to America together with her husband, the portrait artist Rotblat, and she acted in New York, Philadelphia and in the provinces, at first as a prima donna in operettas, afterwards in dramatic roles, grand-dames and mother roles

title: Fanny Vaksman
description: Fanny Vaksman Born on 14 February 1878 in Lodz, Poland.She learned in a folkshul.She had a soprano voice, and at age eleven, her mother entered her as a chorus singer in the troupe of Weinstock-Schorr, which was then guest-starring in Lodz

title: Morris Vaksman
description: Morris Vaksman (Moshe Dovid) Born on 25 July 1874 in Lodz, Poland.His father was cantor for twenty-five years in the Blashker synagogue in London, his grandfather was R' Yakov Vaksman -- a rabbi in Blashke, and a brother -- a magid (preacher).He learned with a Kovel rabbi in Lodz, together with the late actor Samuel Tornberg and Itzhak Zandberg

title: Roza Vaksman
description: Roza Vaksman (Rukhl Dintenfas) She was born in 1874 in Kelnovits, Galicia, to well-to-do parents.As a child V.used to "farshteln" and sing songs

title: Yakov Vaksman
description: Yakov Vaksman Born on 22 October 1866 in Lublin, Poland.His father was a mashkhil, who took up law, so his son didn't get any special Yiddish education.He finished a four-class kroynisher Yiddish school

title: Yitzhak Valdberg
description: Yitzhak Valdberg Born on 21 July 1889 in Lemberg, Galicia.His father was a clothing merchant and a manager of a tailor's workshop.He learned in a cheder, and in a school

title: Jennie Valier
description: Jennie Valier V.was born in Alsace Lorraine, into a Christian family.She acted on the German stage in Germany and Austria, then in New York in the German Irving Place Theatre with Rudolph Christian

title: Shimon Valtsinak
description: Shimon Valtsinak Author of "Der bekanter doktor" or "Vi git lib in im der apikurm" -- "a drama in five acts, [bhutsut bit] commerce, library, school [hmdfis alapin], Warsaw [shnt trmb lp"k"][??].[1882, p.30, 16°]

title: Julia Varadi
description: Julia Varadi (Yehudit Haberman) V.was born in Budapest, Hungary.Her parents were jewelry dealers

title: David Vardi
description: David Vardi (Rozenfeld) V.was born on 13 July 1893 in Volochisk, Volin.He learned in a cheder, and after as a child considered the [lyalkes: legales], which he also used to act the [iridim] in the shtetl, later he participated in the cheder-[mtukn] in the Hebrew children's production honoring Hanukkah and Purim and [nakhgemakht] the guest-starring Ukrainian actors

title: [?] Varman
description: [?] Varman V.participated in the Yiddish productions that took place in 1868-70 in Warsaw under the direction of Gedalya Belloya.In the play "Yakov mit zeyne zin", which was performed in two evenings, V

title: Liza Varon
description: Liza Varon Born 1894 in Jerusalem (Eretz-Israel).Her parents were Sephardic Jewish settlers.When she was six, she left for Cyprus [the island of Cyprus] with her brother and returned to Eretz Yisrael at the age of twelve

title: Moshe Varshe
description: Moshe Varshe V.was born in 1887 in Antopol, Grodno Gubernia, Polish Lithuania.He was educated in Plotsk whereto his parents took him

title: Mishe Vasereykh
description: Misha Vasereykh V.was born in 1909 in Lodz, Poland.He worked in a textile factory, afterwards immigrating to Belgium, where he participated in revolutionary activities

title: Vaynberg
description: Dr.Vaynberg V.is from Bucharest

title: Karl Vaynberg
description: Karl Vaynberg (Khaim Herbst) Born on 15 February 1893 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a sugar baker.He graduated from a primary school

title: Saltshe Vaynberg
description: Saltshe Vaynberg (Sara Likht) She was born on 16 October 1878 in Przemysl, Galicia, into a family of tradesmen.At the age of fifteen she married the actor Herman Vaynberg and performed in the chorus of the Lemberg Polish Opera, where afer a short time, she also became a small party singer.V

title: Shmuel Vaynberg
description: Shmuel Vaynberg Born 1882 in Kishinev, Bessarabia, to deeply religious Hasidic parents.His father was a bookkeeper for a prosperous firm and so burdened with work that he had no time to help raise his children.At age seven Shmuel chanced to get hold of a violin, and “picked out” a melody with one finger

title: Sonya Vaynberg
description: Sonya Vaynberg (Karl) She was born on 9 March 1888 in Odessa, Ukraine.She completed a four-class governmental school and learned in a pro-gymnasium.After school she began to train her voice, and in 1905 she performed in the troupe of Meyerson

title: Shlomo Vayngold
description: Shlomo Vayngold (Spiridon Voik(ts)a) V.was born on 9 August 1889 in Iasi, Romania, to Christian parents.His mother was Italian, his father was a Romanian.) His father passed away when he was eight months old, and when he was nine years old his mother passed away

title: Z. Vaynper
description: Z.Vaynper (Zishe Vaynferlikh) V.was born on 14 April 1892 in Trisk, Volin

title: Barukh Vaynshel
description: Barukh Vaynshel One of the young Yiddish actors from the new generation.V.was the first Moskow delegates of the Yiddish actors chosen to be part of the council of the association

title: [?] Vaynshteyn
description: [?] Vaynshteyn V.was from Odessa.He sang as a tenor together with Sabsey in the wine cellars of Odessa, later entering the chorus of Kompaneyets and yet later acting in lover roles in Sabsey's troupe

title: Ita Vaynshteyn
description: Ita Vaynshteyn V.was born in Southern Russia.She was the wife of actor Saul Vaynshteyn

title: Sophia Vaynshtok
description: Sophia Vaynshtok (Fridman) V.was born in 1866 in Dvinsk, Latvia, to well-to-do parents.Her father was a footwear merchant

title: Ayzik Vaynstok
description: Ayzik Vaynstok Born on 24 December 1890 in Yagelnitza (Jagielnica), Eastern Galicia, into a mashkhil-Orthodox home.He learned until age fifteen in a cheder, and at the same time in a Baron Hirsch folkshul.Feeling a narrow intellect in Yagelnitza, V

title: Moshe Vayntroyb
description: Moshe Vayntroyb W.was in Brody [according to Sholem Pochamtshe -- in Kaminka Strumilova by Brody].He was a badkhan (comedian), and afterwards became a Broder Singer

title: Asher Zelig Vays
description: Asher Zelig Vays Born in Michalovtze, Hungary.Successor and student of Hersh Leib Sigeter.Composed several novels and story-scenes in Yiddish; also published ten booklets with songs, to which he by himself created music

title: Enrico Vays
description: Enrico Vays He was in 1887 in San Antonio, province Entro Khyos.His parents were colonists.He was educated in the Yiddish-Spanish school

title: John Vays
description: John Vays He was in July 1876 in Iasi, Romania.His father was a merchant of fur ware, who would later immigrate to America.He studied in a cheder and later in a Romanian school

title: Marsela Vays
description: Marsela Vays (Levin) V.was born on 22 January 1896 in Sao Paulo, Brazil.Her father was the journalist Zigmunt Levin, the founder of the Yiddish press and of the Yiddish theatre in Argentina

title: Paulina Vays
description: Paulina Vays V.was born in 1884 in Kishinev, Bessarabia.Her father was a lease holder of the post and an animal dealer

title: Feivl Vaysberg
description: Feivl Vaysberg V.was born on 25 September 1896 in Drohitshin, Grodno Gubernia, Polish Lithuania, to Chasidic parents.His father was a grain merchant

title: Sam Vaysberg
description: Sam Vaysberg He was born circa 1870 in Warsaw, Poland.Most of the time, V.had been engaged to directing troupes, for which he visited new countries and cities

title: Chaim Vaysbeyn
description: Chaim Vaysbeyn V.was born in 1881 in Vitebsk, White Russia.At the age of fifteen he was connected with the Yiddish theatre

title: Yitzhok-Meir Vaysenberg
description: Yitzhok-Meir Vaysenberg Born in 1881 in Zhelikhov, Siedlce Gubernia, Poland, into a poor family.He learned in a cheder and in his early youth became a worker.For twenty-five years he took to various trades in Warsaw and Lodz

title: Moshe Vaysfeld
description: Moshe Vaysfeld V.was born in Warsaw, Poland.He was the owner of a business school in Warsaw (corner of Dzhika and Volinska), in which in 1883 Yiddish theatre productions were staged in the evenings

title: Helena Vaysman
description: Helena Vaysman V.was born on 5 October 1889 in Lemberg, Galicia.Her father was a clockmaker

title: Morris Vaysman
description: Morris Vaysman Born in 1880 in Iasi, Rumania.In America, he began to act with "amateurs".As a professional actor he had acted in various troupes, mostly itinerant, across the small communities in America and Canada

title: Bentsion Vekshteyn
description: Bentsion Vekshteyn He was born on 3 March 1868 in Ilinits, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine, into a Chasidic merchant family.In his early youth he printed cultural-heretical articles in "Hshkhr", "Hmlits", "Yudishes folksblat".At the age of seventeen he immigrated to London, later to America, where he was more active in the Jewish Worker's Movement

title: Misha Veksler
description: Misha (Michal) Veksler Born in 1917 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.His parents were owners of a soda factory.According to David Pergament: "V

title: Helena Velish
description: Helena Velish (Inventarzsh) She was born in 1907 in Grochov, near Warsaw, Poland.Her father was an estate lessee(?) Later she moved to Warsaw.She began her stage career by traveling with the provincial troupe under the direction of Chaim Sandler across Poland, and continued since then with the Yiddish theatre

title: Aneta Veltman
description: Aneta Veltman (Anna) V.was born in Bucharest, Romania.Her father was a Sephardic Jew

title: S. Verite
description: S.Verite(S.Vaysblat) Born in Bessarabia, lived in Odessa, where he was a student of a Russian dramatic school and belongs to the initiative group with which Peretz Hirshbein had in1908 founded as the "Hirshbein Troupe." Later he became a Yiddish actor and especially was popular across Russia as an excellent reader of Sholem Aleichem

title: Klara Vetshteyn
description: Klara Vetshteyn (Nekheles-Buksenboym) Born in 1875 in Lemberg, Galicia.Her father was a tailor.At the age of fourteen she performed as a member of a chorus in Gimpel's Theatre, and a short time afterwards she began to act in roles

title: Sonya Vidov
description: Sonya Vidov She was born on 23 April 1899 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.Her father was a lumber merchant.She learned in a cheder and afterwards in a four-class school

title: Moshe-Dovid Vidrevitsh
description: Moshe-Dovid Vidrevitsh Born on 18 January 1867 in Vitebsk, White Russia, into a family of great pedigree.After his marriage he tried trading, but without success.For thirty years he was a Hebrew teacher in Warsaw

title: Vitya Viktorov
description: Vitya (Avigdor) Viktorov Born in 1914, son of Berl Waxman, administrator of a Yiddish theatre.At the age of twenty-nine, he fell at the Front in the struggle against the Nazis.Sh

title: Herman Vild
description: Herman Vild V.was a cantor in Sereth, Bukovina.Then he became a folksinger, and he used to sing his own composed compositions, and he was especially popular with his song "Di tsigeynerin"

title: Regina Viner-Likhtiger
description: Regina Viner-Likhtiger V.was born on 25 March 1900 in Lodz, Poland.Her parents were merchants

title: Gertrude Vinik
description: Gertrude Vinik V.was born on 25 May 1904 in Stepin, Rovno region, Volin.Her father was a house builder

title: Viniver
description: Viniver V.was a badkhan from Hungary.He often used to come to Galicia to wealthy weddings, for which he used to perform "shtik"

title: Betty Vinovits
description: Betty Vinovits V.was born in Odessa, Ukraine.Her father was the orchestra conductor for Goldfaden in Odessa, where V.also acted in small roles

title: Frida Vitalina
description: Frida Vitalina (Shimaliska, Lapin) W.was born on 5 June 1886 in Vilna, Poland/Lithuania.Her father was the founder of a travel agency

title: Fishl Vitkover
description: Fishl Vitkover Born on 13 June 1889 in Kristopol, Galicia, in a Chasidic home.He studied in German Christian science and theology.And according to an unverified sounds, crossing over to Christian beliefs

title: B. Vladeck
description: B.Vladeck (Barukh-Nakhman Charney) V.was born on 1 January 1886 in Dukor, White Russia (today Dukora, Belarus -- ed.)

title: Velvl Vladir
description: Velvl Vladir V.was born in 1894 in Kishinev, Bessarabia.According to Julian Schwartz he was a folk-actor, a cultured (person), who acted in father roles in professional Yiddish theatre

title: Pesye Volfine
description: Pesye Volfine She was born on 1 April 1904 in Brest-Litovsk, Polish Lithuania.Her father was a shoemaker.In 1915 V

title: M. Volgeshafen
description: M.Volgeshafen According to Regina Prager: "Volgeshafen" was a retired soldier, and [around 1885] there arrived in Galicia a concession of the Yiddish theatre.He put together a troupe (Chaim-Shmuel Lukatsher, Meyerovitsh and his wife, Liza Eynhorn, Sam Adler, et al), and then they performed across the state and cities of Galicia

title: David Volkenshteyn
description: David Volkenshteyn Born in 1891 in the Ukraine.Was one of the vogiikste Soviet novelists.He began his literary activity with a Russian story in Gorki's collection book "Lyetofis", then collaborated in the Russian daily newspaper "Kievskaya misl", a'a Russian periodicals

title: Vorobeytshik
description: Vorobeytshik He was a substitute coworker for the Odessa Museum, who...the name....Mendele Mukher Sefarim.He wrote reviews about Yiddish theatre

title: Shmuel Vulman
description: Shmuel Vulman V.was born on 12 February 1896 in Kalushin, Warsaw region, Poland, into a poor, Chasidic family.He learned in a cheder, Beit HaMedrash, later, through [his own culture=zelbstbildung], acquired secular knowledge

title: Lyuba Vyesyolaya
description: Lyuba Vyesyolaya (Shoskin) V.was born in 1897 in Nesvizh, Minsk Gubernia, White Russia.As a child of six she went with her family to Lugansk (Luhansk, Ukraine today -- ed.), where she learned in school and would attract attention due to her beautiful voice

title: Ida Vysotsky
description: Ida Vysotsky V.was born in September 1903 in Slonim, Grodno Gubernia, Polish Lithuania, into a working family.She completed a Yiddish school, a four-class gymnasium, and Yiddish pedagogical courses

title: Ben Zion Wagner
description: Ben Zion Wagner.Born 1889 in Zyrardow, Warsaw region, Poland.Father - a sewing machine mechanic

title: A. Waiter
description: A.Waiter (Isaac Meir Devenishski) Born in June [July?] 1878 [1879?, according to Z.Reyzen on his passport from six years of age [according to E

title: Benny Wallerstein
description: Benny Wallerstein W.was born on 22 August 1899 in London, England.His parents were the actors Esther and Saul Wallerstein

title: Ella Wallerstein
description: Ella Wallerstein (Geshpas) W.was born on 24 September 1892 in Lemberg, Galicia.Her father was a tailor

title: Esther Wallerstein
description: Esther Wallerstein (Goldstein) W.was born on 18 October 1877 in Grodno, Polish Lithuania, into a pious family.Her mother was the owner of a fruit store

title: Hymie Wallerstein
description: Hymie Wallerstein W.was born in 1867 in Grodno, Polish Lithuania, to parents who were innkeepers.He came with his family to America and here completed public school

title: Rose Wallerstein
description: Rose Wallerstein W.was born on 25 January 1896 in New York, America.Her father is the actor Hymie Wallerstein

title: Saul Wallerstein
description: Saul Wallerstein W.was born on 3 February 1873 in Kovno, Lithuania.His parents were innkeepers

title: Pola Walter
description: Pola Walter (Shreyder) She was born in Riga, Lettland (Latvia).Her parents were owners of a clothing business, which was moved across to Vilna.Here W

title: Feivl Warshavsky
description: Feivl Warshavsky (Iserovski) Born on 8 July 1897 in Wlodzislaw, Kielce Gubernia, Poland.His grandfather on his mother's side -- Kielce rabbi R' Velvele Treisman, and aged uncle of the Ger rabbi the "shfs emes".He learned in Makow's yeshiva, also had a little secular education

title: Yitskhok Meir Warshavsky
description: Yitskhok Meir Warshavsky (Iserovski) Born in 1890 in Voydislav (Wodzislaw -- ed.), Kielce Gubernia, to Chasidic parents.He received a strong Orthodox education and, after moving over to Lodz, received an elementary education.His stage career began as a Polish-Yiddish coupletist, and then he acted for a season in Polish with the actors Ludvinski and Shotland

title: Jakob Wasserman
description: Jakob Wasserman W.was born in 1880 in Plotsk, Poland.In all he wandered across Western Galicia, America, India, and other lands

title: Michael Weichert
description: Dr.Michael Weichert Born on 5 May 1890 in Staremiasto, Galicia-Podolia.His father was a grain merchant, a half-mashkhil, and a half-msngd

title: Miriam Weide
description: Miriam Weide (Weidenfeld) W.was born in 1897 in Warsaw, Poland.She completed a middle school and then worked in a bank

title: Moshe Weide
description: Moshe Weide W.was born in 1895 in Warsaw, Poland.M

title: Harry Weinberg
description: Harry Weinberg (Aaron) Born on 1 July 1891 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was an employee in Rosenberg's parve mill.He learned in a cheder, and in the community Talmud Torah

title: Herman Weinberg
description: Herman Weinberg Born in 1863 in Lemberg, Galicia.Descended from a Vibranavker tsadik.From age seven until age twelve he sang with cantors and in Lemberg's temple with Cantor Bachman

title: Karl Weinberg
description: Karl Weinberg (Chaim Herbst) W.was born on 15 February 1893 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a sugar baker

title: Moshe Weinberg
description: Moshe Weinberg Born on 5 October 1872 in Lemberg, Eastern Galicia.He was the brother of Herman W.From age six to sixteen he sang in a chorus of a Lemberg temple, and then he entered into the troupe of Gimpel, where Goldfaden staged then, "Doctor Yozelman," and gave him the three small roles of "Birgermeister (Mayor)," "Pfaltz" and "Kenig (King)." After acting for four years in this theatre, W

title: Yeshayahu Daniel Weinberg
description: Yeshayahu Daniel [S.D.] Weinberg Born on 15 June 1888 in Bialo Mazovietsk, Poland, into a well-to-do family.He learned in a cheder, Beit HaMedrash

title: Charles Weinblatt
description: Charles Weinblatt (Kalmen) W.was born on 19 May 1877 in Braila, Romania.His father was he actor Israel Weinblatt.

title: Israel Weinblatt
description: Israel Weinblatt (Wurtzl) Born in 1853 in Sadagora, Galicia.His grandfather R' Shabtai'le was cantor, his father a Hebrew teacher.According to Mrs

title: Boris Weiner
description: Boris Weiner W.was born on 17 August 1895 in Piotrkow, Minsk Gubernia, White Russia (Belarus).His father was a timber merchant

title: Bracha Weiner
description: Bracha Weiner **Editor's note: Needs work.In "Arbeter tsaytung" (Journal, N'295, 1928), it was written: "She was known in each city and shtetl of Bessarabia, Bukovina and Regat.An itinerant Yiddish actress, she was a homeless person, a movable undnitse? who had roamed about the earth for different, arranging here an amateur production, here a literary evening with whom she used to do declarations as Bialik, Peretz, and other poets

title: Helena Weiner
description: Helena Weiner Born in 1875 in Peterburg, Russia.At the age of thirteen she entered into work in a factory, early on as a lern-meydl, then as a worker.W

title: Shlomo Weingold
description: Shlomo Weingold (Spiridian Voyka) Born on 9 August 1889 in Iasi, Romania, to Christian parents (his mother -- an Italian woman, his father -- a Romanian).At six months his father died, and when he was nine years old -- his mother.Not being able to move over to the treatment(?) of his other family members, W

title: Max Weinreich
description: Dr.Max Weinreich (Meir) Born on 22 April 1894 in Goldingen, Courland.Father -- a merchant

title: I.J. Weinrot
description: I.J.Weinrot(Yitzhak Yosef) Born on 5 November 1905 in Lodz, Poland.Father -- a bookbinder

title: Joseph Weinshelbaum
description: Joseph Weinshelbaum W.was born in 1890 in Proskurov, Podolia Gubernia., Ukraine, to not well-to-do parents.He completed a Yiddish-Russian government school

title: Bernard Weinstein
description: Bernard Weinstein W.was born on 10 July 1866 in Odessa, Ukraine, into a poor family.When he was young he became an orphan, and W

title: Charles Weinstein
description: Charles Weinstein W.was born on 15 June 1890 in Romanov, Galicia.He learned in cheder, in a yeshiva in Kluyzenburg (Hungary)

title: Sol Weinstein
description: Sol Weinstein As Goldfaden had delivered/passed told to Sh.L.Citron, W

title: Joseph Weinstock
description: Joseph Weinstock Born on 19 April 1858 in Kremenitz, Volin Gubernia.His father was a non-Orthodox rabbi.He completed a four-class gymnasium and a rabbinical school in Zhitomir

title: Simcha Weinstock
description: Simcha Weinstock Born in 1898 in Lodz, Poland, into a merchant family.He completed a Yiddish-Polish gymnasium, later for a time worked in a printing shop.In his younger years he directed with the dramatic studio "Baginen" for the "Bund" in Lodz

title: Frances Weintraub
description: Frances Weintraub (Feyne) W.was born on 5 October 1895 in New York, America.Her parents were the actors Rivka and Zigmund Weintraub

title: Milton Weintraub
description: Milton Weintraub W.was born on 24 November 1897 in New York, America.His parents were the Yiddish actors Zigmunt and Rivka Weintraub {"Lexicon of the Yiddish Theatre", Vol

title: Rebecca Weintraub
description: Rebecca Weintraub (Rivka Fusfeld) W.was born in 1874 in Brody, Galicia.Her parents were poor tailors

title: Sally Weintraub
description: Sally Weintraub According to Bader's Calendar, W.was a coupletist and a variety actress.W

title: Sigmund Weintraub
description: Sigmund Weintraub (Zygmunt) Born in November 1874 in Belz, Bessarabia.Parents -- owners of a haberdashery business.Until age eleven he learned in cheders and in a governmental school, later with a teacher

title: Simcha Weintraub
description: Simcha Weintraub (Fisfeld; Symcha Wajntraub) V.was born on 4 February 1890 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was a boy-entrepreneur

title: W. Weintraub
description: W.Weintraub Born in Lovitsh (Łowicz), Poland, to Chasidic parents.As a child, W

title: Leah Weintraub-Graf
description: Leah Weintraub-Graf Born on 10 September 1888 in Botashan, Rumania Her father worked in the Yiddish theatre.A year later she was taken with her family over to Bucharest where W.studied in the evangelical school and learned Yiddish in the home

title: Leon Weisenfeld
description: Leon Weisenfeld Born on 7 February 1885 in Zheskov (Rzeszow -- ed.), Galicia, to pious parents.He learned in a cheder and privately with a teacher.At the age of fourteen, he immigrated to Germany, and five years later he came with his brother to America

title: Muni Weisenfreund
description: Muni Weisenfreund (Meshilem Meier; Paul Muni) Muni Weisenfreund (Veyzenfreynd), a.k.a.Paul Muni, was born in September 1897 (according to a verbal declaration by Z.Zylbercweig--1895] -- in Lemberg, Galicia

title: Phillip Weisenfreund
description: Phillip Weisenfreund Born in 1860 in Nadvorna, Galicia.His father used to import colonial goods from Hungary.He learned in a cheder and as a youth sang with a cantor

title: Salli Weisenfreund
description: Salli Weisenfreund (Khaya Tsilke Fishler) W.was born in 1876 in Stanislawow, Galicia.When she was a year-and-a-halfold her mother passed away, and her father took her to stay with her grandmother

title: Avraham-Yakov Weislitz
description: Avraham-Yakov (Jacob) Weislitz W.was born on 31 December 1891 in Konsk, Poland.His father was a cultured person and left him to study in a gymnasium

title: Yocheved Weislitz
description: Yocheved Weislitz (Provizor) W.was born in 1889 in Bloyne, by Warsaw, Poland.After her marriage to Jacob Weislitz, she acted with him in her first dramatic role in the various Yiddish dramatic productions across the Polish provinces

title: Aaron Weisman
description: Aaron Weisman Born on 10 April 1887 in Belaya Tserkov, Ukraine.Parents -- owners of a colonial business.He learned in a cheder, and when his family moved to Odessa, W

title: Bernardo Weisman
description: Bernardo Weisman Born in 1873 in Bucharest, Rumania, to Orthodox parents.He was a choirboy in the local large shul with Cantor Avraham Frakhtenberg.Afterwards with the cantors Sholam, Goldenberg et al

title: Louis Weiss
description: Louis Weiss (Louie) Born on 15 August 1891 in Uman, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.Father -- supervisor in his brother's garden chateau, where they used to perform theatre and also used to direct the technical work when Yiddish troupes used to act there.W

title: Wilhelm Weiss
description: Wilhelm Weiss W.was Kapellmeister and artistic leader for [tsen guts] variety.W

title: Louis Weissberg
description: Louis Weissberg Born on 13 August, 1883 in Kiev, Ukraine.His parents were merchants.W

title: Rachel Weissberg
description: Rachel Weissberg Born on 23 of February 1901 in Sadagora, Bukovina.Her father was a business man.She finished her learning in Novoselitz in an elementary school, and after arriving in 1913 with the family in Vienna, finished there in a public and commercial school

title: Bessie Weissman
description: Bessie Weissman She was born in New York, America.Her father was the prompter and playwright Reuben Weissman.As a four-year-old child, until age ten, she acted in children's roles with Adler and Thomashefsky

title: Dora Weissman
description: Dora Weissman W.was the wife of actor Morris Weissman ("Der shvartser Weisman"), and followed the same acting path as her husband.Sholem Santop pictured her in this way: "Dora was a [less/lower=nidrike] Jew with several [mordes?], and almost without a [neck=haldz]

title: Dora Weissman
description: Dora Weissman She was born in Odessa, Ukraine.Her father was a prompter and playwright Reuben Weissman.As a two-year-old child she immigrated with her family to America and a year later went onto the stage, because a child fell in the play "Moshe rabeinu", and she then had to play "Moshe"

title: Reuben Weissman
description: Reuben Weissman Born on 25 February 1855 in Odessa, Ukraine.His father was a shokhet (ritual slaughterer), then an owner of a restaurant, who gave him a traditional, Jewish education with designs to make him a rabbi.W

title: Israel Welichansky
description: Israel Welichansky Born in Brest-Litovsk, Russia-Lita, into a rabbinic family.Father -- a scholar.Mother -- maintained a candy store and a bakery

title: Ruben Wendorf
description: Ruben Wendorf Born 1892 in Minsk, White Russia.Started a stage career with Hirshbein’s troupe and then played in Povsky’s Folks Theatre.He left for London before World War I and returned to Russia after the October revolution

title: Leola Wendorff
description: Leola Wendorff(Vaserman) Born in Warsaw, Poland, into a very religious family.Father -- a former Nikolayev soldier, who traded lumber and animals in Russia.She learned with "small rbile" verses and Rashi, and privately with a Russian and Polish teacher

title: Mishel-Adolf Werbel
description: Mishel-Adolf Werbel (Moshe Avraham) W.was born in 1850 in Odessa, Ukraine.His father was the poet Eliahu Mordechai Werbel

title: Clara Wetstein
description: Clara Wetstein (Nekheles-Buksenboym) W.was born in 1875 in Lemberg, Galicia.Her father was a tailor

title: David Wetstein
description: David Wetstein W.was born in 1874 in Krakow, Galicia.His father was a tailor

title: Jacob Wexler
description: Jacob Wexler Born 10 April 1882 in Sekareny, Bessarabia.His father was an Orthodox tobacco merchant.W

title: Batya Wiernik
description: Batya Wiernik W.was born on 21 March 1884 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.She is the sister of Peretz Wiernik

title: Yitzhak Wiernik
description: Yitzhak Wiernik Born on 6 January 1886 in Odessa, Ukraine.Father -- a small dealer.He was raised by his grandfather in Praga, Warsaw

title: Jacob Wigodski
description: Dr.Jacob Wigodski W.was born on 3 April 1857 in Bobruisk, Minsk Gubernia, White Russia

title: Bernard Wilensky
description: Bernard Wilensky Born approximately in 1866 in Bialystok, Poland, Wilensky’s parents were merchants who gave their son Bernard a traditional Jewish education.His teacher was Sh.Yanovsky

title: Julian Wilensky
description: Julian Wilensky W.was born in 1882 in Kherson, Ukraine.He came, together with Hurwitz's troupe, to America and performed at the Windsor Theatre, where he acted for only half a season, also performing in Yiddish in the opera "Aida", "Payatzn (Clowns)", and "Carmen", later moving over to Aged in vaudeville

title: Mary Wilensky
description: Mary Wilensky (Miryam Katz) W.was born in April 1876 in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was a writer in the "rathoyz"

title: Michael Wilensky
description: Michael Wilensky (Mikhal) W.was born on 18 September (A.S.) 1880 in Priluki, Poltava Gubernia, Ukraine

title: Max Wilner
description: Max Wilner Wilner was born on 18 December 1895 in Bzhozov (Brzozow), Galicia, to Chasidic parents.His father was a prayer leader.W

title: Max R. Wilner
description: Max R.Wilner Born on 25 December 1881 in New York, America.Father -- the owner of a tailor workshop

title: Morris Winchevsky
description: Morris Winchevsky (Bentsion Novachovits) Born on 9 August 1856 in Yanove, Kovno, Lite, into a pious, prominent family.He was raised in Kovno, wherein his parents raised him for seven years.There he learned Gemara, and at the same time also attended crown folks-shul

title: Leyb Winer
description: Leyb Winer W.was born in 1913 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.His father was a women's tailor

title: Anatol Winogradoff
description: Anatol Winogradoff (Naftali-Herts Glikman) Born on 2 October 1890 in Berezna, Vilna Gubernia.His parents were merchants.He was educated in Kiev, and he learned in a Russian gymnasium

title: Joseph Winogradoff
description: Joseph Winogradoff (Vaynshteyn) Born in 1868 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.Father -- a poor furrier/hatter, a musician, in a cheder and "helped" his father at home.At the age of eight he came to Cantor Feinzilber, a year later in a choral school with Cantor Michaleski

title: Benzion Witler
description: Benzion Witler Born in Belz, Galicia.His grandfather, R' Ira Lokman, was the head gabbai (sexton) for the Belz rabbi.He received a genuine, traditional Jewish education in Vienna, Austria, where his family migrated to when he was six years old

title: Herman Wohl
description: Herman Wohl(Tsvi) Born on 8 September 1877 in Otinya, by Stanislawow, Eastern Galicia.His father was a religious storekeeper.He learned in a school and with a religious teacher

title: Israel Meir Wohlman
description: Israel Meir Wohlman Born in 1821 -- according to "Dovid Rabeynu Vesofryu" -- and based upon an obituary, his birthday was on the 27th of June 1828.The newspaper "Haynt" gives the year as 1817.According to Z

title: Yehuda-Leib Wohlman
description: Yehuda-Leib Wohlman Born on 29 November 1880 in Konskovolye, Lublin Gubernia, Poland, a son of Hebrew writer Mendl Volman.Until the age of twenty he learned general studies and at the same time also his mother tongue and arithmetic, afterwards becoming an auto-didact and was introduced to European literature.From his calling as a manufacturer, W

title: Arthur Wolf
description: Arthur Wolf In 1920 in New York his play "Yekl Furman" was performed.B.Gorin -- "History of the Yiddish Theatre", Viol

title: Simon Wolf
description: Simon Wolf (Simcha) Born on 12 September 1890 in Boryslaw, Western Galicia, to pious parents.He became an orphan as a youth, and his mother strove to allow him to learn Yiddish, Polish and German.After several years she went away to America, and he with several children, remained in Galicia with relatives

title: Aaron Wolfsohn-Halle
description: Aaron Wolfsohn-Halle W.was born in 1754 (according to Zeitlin’s "Kirias Sefer"—1756) in Halle, Freisen Municipality in Germany.His father was a doctor and his mother, apparently, was affiliated with the followers of the Enlightenment

title: Chona Wolfstal
description: Chona Wolfstal Born in 1851 [according to Reyzen's "Lexicon" -- 1853] in Mishmienitze, near Stanislawow, Galicia.His father was a city cantor, a good musician with a great love of music, which he had also planned for his seven sons.Driven by income concerns, the family settled in Tarnopol, where they organized themselves as the "Wolfstal Band"

title: Avraham Wolfstat
description: Avraham Wolfstat Born on 20 December 1897 in Khentshin (Chęciny), Kielce kreyz, Poland.His father was a melamed; his mother wrote songs, and through her influence, W.attended the Yiddish folkshul and later learned privately with a tutor

title: Yakov-Mordechai Wolfzon
description: Yakov-Mordechai Wolfzon W.was born in 1867 in Aleksandrye, Volin.He debuted in 1886 with a feuilleton in the "Yidish folksblat"

title: Ita Wolhendler-Krause
description: Ita Wolhendler-Krause (Volhendler-Kroyze) Born 16, April 1898 in Czestochowa, Poland into a Chassidic family.Her father was long-time prayer leader for the Piltser Rebbe.Until age fifteen she studied in a girl's school and as a soprano sang in various choirs

title: M. Workel
description: M.Workel Born in 1878 in Varaklani, Rezhitsa kreyz, White Russia, into a poor family.At age five he became an orphan, W

title: Yekhezkel Wortsman
description: Dr.Yekhezkel Wortsman W.was born in 1878 in Zvanyetz, Podolia Gubernia, to well-to-do parents

title: Chaim Yablokoff
description: Chaim Yablokoff Y.was born August 11, 1902 in Grodno, Polish Lithuania.He graduated from a Hebrew school and sang as a choir boy with Yoshe Slonimer, the city cantor; then he traveled about with other cantors

title: Avraham-Yitzhak Yablonski
description: Avraham-Yitzhak Yablonski (Yablonko) Y.was born in 1888 in Warsaw, Poland.His father was the owner of a "notions" shop, and he passed away when he was six years old, the small orphan had almost raised himself, and he learned and wrote with the help of a "zelbst-" teacher

title: Mordechai Yachson
description: Mordechai Yachson Born on 7 December 1897 in Odessa, Ukraine.Father -- a Chasid.Owner of a boot-stitching business

title: Zakhar Yagoda
description: Zakhar Yagoda Y.was born on 10 September 1898 in Ostroleka, Lomza Gubernia, Poland.His father was a tinsmith

title: Zalmen Yakhnes
description: Zalmen Yakhnes Born on 25 December 1911 in Smilovitch, White Russia.His parents were laborers.From his youth he manifested signs of an indignant humor, which had with time evolved into a desire for the stage

title: Mozes Yakob
description: Mozes (Moshe-Yakov) Yakob He was born cir 1857 in Krakow, western Galicia, where he was a teacher of religion.At a certain time he was a censor for Yiddish in the Krakow district and nearby villages, when a Yiddish concert or theatre came to perform.From 1919-23 he was the director of the Yiddish theatre in Krakow, under the artistic direction of Leopold Yungvirt

title: Yakov ben Yekhezkel from Posnan
description: Yakov ben Yechezkel from Poznan In the theatre museum of YIVO, one can find an example of "The Jewish Story of Esther and Mordechai." A sad story in five acts which has a happy ending.Written in an incomparable manner it is both written and performed in a distinctive Jewish language.It will be presented on three nights in differing styles

title: A.L. Yakubovitsh
description: A.L.Yakubovitsh Y.was born circa 1880 in Sniadowo, Lomza region, Poland

title: Leyzer Yakubovitsh
description: Leyzer Yakubovitsh Y.was born in Odessa, Ukraine.He was a wheat "zipper"

title: Lola Yakubovitsh
description: Lola Yakubovitsh (Salfish) Y.was born in May 1906 in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was a ticket controller in the Yiddish theatre and as such Y

title: Lyosha Yakubovitsh
description: Lyosha Yakubovitsh Y.was born in Brzhezhin, near Lodz, Poland.Due to her father's death she was raised by an uncle in Zgerzh, near Lodz, where she had an opportunity to see a Yiddish troupe act

title: Yaakov Yakubovitsh
description: Yaakov Yakubovitsh Born on 22 February 1896 in Lodz, Poland, to not well-to-do parents.He was the brother of the actor Hyman Y.In his autobiography (written in 1928), according to that, his father was a trustee (gabai), and a bel-tefilah (prayer leader) in a small synagogue, and at home used to sing over various melodies, which he later used at the pulpit

title: [?] Yakubzon
description: [?] Yakubzon Y.was manager of the "Hirshbein Troupe".The actor Sh

title: A. Yam
description: A.Yam [Yakov Avraham Yerukhomovitsh -- Y.A

title: Yasha Yanka
description: Yasha Yanka He was born in 1894 in Odessa, Ukraine.He is the brother of the actress Goldya Dranov and Sarah Kushchinksa.At the age of fourteen, Y

title: Yankele mit der harmonye
description: Yankele mit der harmonye (Hirshenbeyn) Y.was born in Baku, Rumania, into a rich family.For several years he worked as a bookkeeper in Pepper's lumber factory

title: David Yanover
description: David Yanover Y.was born on 18 February 1893 in Kornin, Kiev Gubernia, Ukraine.As a child he came [tsuza] with his parents to America, and here completed public and high school and he participated in the school productions

title: Saul Yosef Yanovsky
description: Saul Yosef Yanovsky Y.was born in April 1864 in Pinsk, Poland.His father was a cantor

title: B. Yanpolski
description: B.Yanpolski Born in 1900 in Glukhov, Chernigrod Gubernia, Ukraine.His father was a worker in calcium distillery

title: Mordechai Yardeini
description: Mordechai Yardeini (Motl Sherman) Born on 16 July 1906 [according to his mother's account -- 1908] in Slovechno, Volin Gubernia, Ukraine.On his mother's side -- lumber merchant, footwear and grain trader and contractor.Father -- a merchant, a prayer leader and a Gemora melamed

title: Elihu Zalmen Yarikhovski
description: Elihu Zalmen Yarikhovski Y.was born in 18...in Lodz or Pietrkow, Poland

title: Zlata Yaroslavska
description: Zlata Yaroslavska Y.was born in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.He was raised by the theatre director Nahum and the actress Esther Lipovski

title: Hersh Yedvab
description: Hersh Yedvab Born in 1870 in Lodz, Poland.For a profession he was a textile worker (shearer).In his younger years he began to participate in "amateur" productions and especially later became popular as a monologist of Sholem Aleichem works et al

title: Rosetta Yeger
description: Rosetta Yeger (Faget) Y.was born on 28 March 1896 in Warsaw, Poland.Her grandfather was the Warsaw marshal Shlomo Faget

title: Yehoash
description: Yehoash (Shlomo; Solomon Bloomgarden) Y.was born in April 1871 in Wierzbolow (now Virbaln), Suwalki region, Poland.His father was a religious scholar and a maskhil (cultured person); his mother was a "barren woman"

title: Yehudis
description: Yehudis (Rukhel Bernshteyn) Y.was born at the end of 1869 in Minsk, White Russia, into the well-to-do family of shopkeepers.Under the influence of the Socialist Movement she became a reader of Russian literature, later uniting with the New Yiddish literature, and she began by herself to write Yiddish, and she debuted in 1907 with a chapter of memoirs "A vinter shbt" in "Der freynd", then she wrote songs, a novel, etc

title: Rosa Yermolina-Veysman
description: Rosa Yermolina-Veysman(Rukhl Yarmolintser) Y.was born circa 1850 in Kamenets Podolskiy Gubernia, Ukraine.Her mother was a "grandmothe", a brother, or another close neighbor -- she was a [fokusnik], as it was

title: Yevina
description: Yevina Y.was the wife of actor and director Ilia Korik, with whom she co-created, helped, and directed the Yiddish theatre career of her husband.Y

title: Chava Yoelit
description: Chava Yoelit (Grinshpan) Y.was born in Oriev, Bessarabia.From her early youth she loved to recite, and at the age of seven she participated in Russian school productions

title: Moshe Yofe
description: Moshe (Moiesi) Yofe Y.was an actor and assistant regisseur for the Vilna Troupe at its founding.According to Noakh Nakhbush, he didn't act on the stage, but probably in the beginning of the Vilna Troupe was connected as an administrator

title: Yakov Yofe
description: Yakov Yofe Y.was a singer who perished in the Riga Ghetto.Sh

title: Malvina Yoles-Gimpel
description: Malvina Yoles-Gimpel She was born on 3 June 1900 in Lemberg, Galicia.She graduated from a state-operated school.She sang for four or five years in a local temple

title: Nate Yongelson
description: Nate (Natan) Yongelson Y.was born in 1893 in Riga, Latvia.He attended the local city gymnasium, and under the pseudonym "Sovsky", for the first time he performed on 28 September 1909 as "Postmaster" in Gogol's "Revizor (The Inspector General)" in Nezlobin's city theatre, where he remained for the following season

title: Jacob Yongman
description: Jacob Yongman (Yakov Yunkman) He was born on 17 December 1887 in Kreitsburg (today Krustpils, Latvia -- ed.), Vitebsk Gubernia, White Russia.His father was a lumber merchant.Y

title: Yosele the Blind
description: Yosele the Blind S.was a [sgi-nhur].Most of the time he used to perform in the wine cellars of Zlotshev and at times traveled to Lemberg to "guest star"

title: Chaim Yosilis
description: Chaim Yosilis There was no biographical data about Y., not until now.From the title page of his play, one can see that he was a carpenter in Sokilen, Volin.In 1874 in Zhitomir there was published his The second eyzin [iron?] volume [rail] from Zarbinits to Yurkats by Chaim Yosilis, carpenter msokilen, the first part, Zhitomir 1874

title: Rubin Youkelson
description: Rubin Youkelson Born on 3 June 1885 in the village of Gebirivke, near Zhitomir, Volin, to impoverished parents.His father used to He learned in a cheder, where he used to travel outside of town to markets as an assistant to the dry goods merchants.He studied in a cheder (Yiddish elementary school) where he quickly mastered the classes in which he was taught the commentaries of Rashi on the Five books of Moses

title: Bernard Young
description: Bernard Young (Boaz Yungvits) Born in March 1870 in Nowy Dwor, Poland.His father was a contractor, his mother an ashet-khil; he knew Gemara, and on Shabbat afternoon he would pre-listen to the children's Gemara page.At is home he also often used to listen to the cantors

title: Clara Young
description: Clara Young (Chaya-Risye Shpikolitser) Y.was born in Zlotshev, eastern Galicia.Her grandfather was a merchant, for whom his son, a solitary person(?), a mashkhil (cultured, intelligent person -- ed.), "had matured in the home"

title: Shlomo Yudson
description: Shlomo Yudson Y.was born on 28 March 1878 in Deretshin, Grodno region, Poland.He learned in the Zhetler yeshiva with Rabbi R' Moshe-Isaac

title: Yehuda Yulin
description: Yehuda Yulin (Etman) Y.was born in 1888 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania, into a merchant family.He learned in a cheder

title: Ernestine Yungvirt
description: Ernestine Yungvirt (Kerner) Y.was born on 3 April 1891 in Krakow, Western Galicia.In 1912

title: Leopold Yungvirt
description: Leopold (Peretz) Yungvirt Y.was born on 15 April 1891 in Krakow, Western Galicia.His father was a businessman

title: Semyon Yushkevich
description: Semyon Yushkevich Born in 1868 in Odessa, Ukraine.1893 -- Went away to Paris and there finished the medical facultat, in 1897 debuted in Russian with the story "A Tailor" in "Russkoye Bogatstvo".1902 -- published his, in "Sunrise", after his years as a student he wrote down his story "Tsefalung"

title: B. Yushzon
description: B.Yushzon (Moshe Yosman) Born in 1889 in Warsaw, Poland, into a Chasidic family.Until eighteen years of age he learned in a yeshiva and as a 'yeshiva boy' debuted as "Br nsh" in a short sketch in Sh

title: Moshe Zablotsky
description: Moshe Zablotsky Z.was born in 1875 in Slonim, Grodno Gubernia, Poland, as an only child of rich parents.Until age seventeen he learned Talmud and other courses, especially later in a commercial school

title: Noach Zabludovski
description: Noach Zabludovski Z.was born on 4 July 1859 in Bialystok, Poland, to an aristocratic merchant family.He studied in a cheder and became involved, at an young age, with the Jewish Enlightenment Movement (Haskalah)

title: Yosef Zabolinski
description: Yosef Zabolinski Born in Slonim, Grodno Gubernia, Poland.His father was a hat maker.He immigrated to London and became a cantor there

title: Zelig Zabolinski
description: Zelig Zabolinski Born in Slonim, Grodno Gubernia, Poland.His father was a hat maker.He was a poet in school

title: Frida Zagar
description: Frida Zagar (Nemova) Z.was born in 1896 in Odessa, Ukraine, to well-to-do parents.She learned in Jabotinsky's gymnasium

title: Moritz Zagar
description: Moritz Zagar Z.was born in Kolomea, Galicia.He acted in Galicia, afterwards in Argentina, and in 1909 in America in the Philadelphia troupe of Mike Thomashefsky, where he was also the scenic director

title: Zalmen Zagorin
description: Zalmen Zagorin He was born in 1915 in Vilna, Polish Lithuania.Z.was the director of the Vilna marionette theatre "Meydim."

title: Ruth Zahava
description: Ruth Zahava (Goldstein) Born in New York, America, to Orthodox parents.She learned Jewish subjects in a Talmud Torah.She completed public and high school

title: David Zahik
description: David Zahik Born in 1852 in Slovita (Slavuta), Volin, into a Chasidic family.He received a traditional Chasidic education.However later, under the influence of Haskalah, he studied in the Zhitomir rabbinical school, then was a teacher of Hebrew and Russian in Starokonstantin (Starokonstantinov) and Kishinev, where he lived for three to four years

title: Abraham Zak
description: Abraham Zak Z.was born on 15 December 1891 in Amdur, Grodno Gubernia, Polish Lithuania.His father was a teacher

title: Sheftel Zak
description: Sheftel Zak Z.was born on 27 December, 1908 in Grodno, Polish Lithuania.His parents were merchants

title: Zakharia Zakharov
description: Zakharia Zakharov Younger brother of Avraham Gachanski.His father was a furniture maker.Motl Saktsier writes: "He was not a simple carpenter

title: Meir Zakozhanski
description: Meir Zakozhanski Born on 27 March 1886 in Rasne (Ryasna), Mohilev region, Ukraine.His father was a lumber merchant.Z

title: Roye[?] Zaks
description: Roye[?] Zaks She may have come from Odessa.Z.had participated with the first Yiddish troupe in Russia

title: Nekhome Zaltsman
description: Nekhome Zaltsman Z.was born in September 1905 in Smargon, Vilna Gubernia, Polish Lithuania.Her father was a bookkeeper

title: Eliyahu Zaludkowski
description: Eliyahu Zaludkowski(Elias; Zaludkovski) Born in 1886 in Meytse (Mozyr), Grodno Gubernia, Polish Lithuania, and was raised in Kalish, where his father, R' Noakh Lider, arrived there as city cantor.He learned Shemash and Puskim with the Kalish rabbi R' Shimon Hornstein, and at the same time general subjects with a private teacher.From childhood on he manifested musical qualities

title: Izzy Zaluzniak
description: Izzy Zaluzniak Born in 1910.Early on he worked in the Ukrainian theatre, then became an actor in Kiev's Jewish State Theatre for Young People.Yona Radinow writes: "As one writes, there was a human being always flashed with a smile of wisdom and humor

title: Karolina Zamler
description: Karolina Zamler (Keyle Zende) Born on 4 September 1888 in Budapest, Hungary.Her father was a tailor.She studied in a theatre school, and after completing it, she acted and sang in various Hungarian ensembles

title: Paltiel Zamoshtshin
description: Paltiel Zamoshtshin Born on 21 July 1851 in Odessa, Ukraine, to well-to-do parents.He attended the business school and at the same time for five years learned Hebrew with Peretz Smolenski At age seventeen, he went away to Berlin to study architecture in a politechnicum, but due to his uncle's bad business, he couldn't complete his studies, and in 1870 he returned to Odessa, where he took up commerce and dedicated his free time to literature.Z

title: Julia Zandberg
description: Julia Zandberg Z.was born in 1870 in Simferopol, Crimea.Her father was a cantor

title: Tseshiya Zandberg
description: Tseshiya Zandberg (Radalnik) She was born in 189..in Warsaw, Poland.Her father was a supervisor of a brewery

title: Yitzhak Zandberg
description: Yitzhak Zandberg Born in 1871 in Lodz, Poland.Father -- owner of a laundromat.From his early youth he manifested a desire for singing, singing in various quartets and with itinerant singers

title: Jacob Zanger
